Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...except the food”
Reviews.Author: spiceylife
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here in two adjoining rooms at Easter 2012. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The rooms were large and clean. The location was slightly outside most of the tourist sites but well located as we could walk to everything. The service was excellent - friendly, helpful, quick. The only let down was the food. There is no restaurant but there is bar food and a room service for snacks which we ordered the first evening as we were too exhausted from walking all day to go out again. The food was revolting! Breakfast was served in the breakfast room and was also horrible. Depending on the day the scrambled eggs were either like chopped up hard boiled eggs, or watery. The choice was limited. Having said that the rest was lovely, although expensive. The roof garden was gorgeous! And the gym was small but good.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: OriginalJerseyGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week over Easter. It's on a quiet side street, but not too far away from anything. 10 min walks take you to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navonna and the metro - the 87 bus to the Colusseum 2 mins away. Plenty of good restaurants in the surrounding streets. Staff friendly and helpful. And the ShuttleBus fromt the airport (E8 pp each way) stops 5 mins walk away - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: SteAnthony
Reviews.Content: We do not say this lightly but this is the best hotel we have ever stepped foot in, let alone stayed in. We decided to stay at the Mellini following the reviews we found on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. The breakfast is fantastic, the hotel is clean and the staff go out of their way to make your stay as enjoyable and as comfortable as possible. The hotel is in a great location on a nice quiet street. If you are travelling to Rome Dei Mellini is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location. Great rooms. Helpful staff. Would definitely return and recommend”
Reviews.Author: archibald75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a couple in March 2012 for a long weekend. The location is great being midway between Vatican City and Piazza Navona, easy (adult) walking distance for both. Very comfortable rooms. Very helpful friendly staff on reception (manned 24 hrs). Appealing modern decor. Good breakfast buffet. A number of good restaurants within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Josif3
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from five days in Rome and it was fantastic. The location of the hotel is brilliant its central to everything, ten minutes by the river takes you to the spanish steps, in the opposite direction is the Vatican and if you don't fancy the walk there is a bus stop at the end of the road that takes you to the Colosseum. The staff were very friendly the room was spotless and the bed made up twice a day. Breakfast was continental but plenty of choice. The little bar was a nice place to unwind after the long day of walking. There are a couple of traditional restaurants in the road of the hotel, Vito's is excellent. I enjoyed the fact that the hotel was away from the hustle and bustle and in a nice peaceful location but close to everything. We would stay here again it really was great. Rome was absolutely fantastic and the hotel provides plenty of maps and good advice on how to locate places. Make sure you visit the park Villa Borghese we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PortageandMain
Reviews.Content: Booked via BA. Really clean really friendly. Great service. Excellent breakfast. Close to everything. My wife and I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I booked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: scbrown
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to celebrate my 50th birthday booking through Airmiles/Avios. I had wanted a good quality hotel which was close to most of the major attractions in Rome and I certainly wasn't disappointed. Before I travelled to Rome I had contacted the hotel by email for advice on transport from the airport and also restaurant recommendations and was pleasantly surprised that the replies were very prompt. Incidentally the hotel arranged a prestige taxi costing 55 euro and you are met at the airport by the driver. As our flight didn't arrive until 1900 we didn't want to use slower public transport so we used this facility. Our room was a deluxe double and was very nice and very clean. It faced onto the street, which at first concerned me because of potential noise issues,but was very quiet. In fact the area around the hotel is very quiet which is a definite bonus. The only negative thing about the room and this is very picky was that the mattress on the bed was hard and the shower is in the bath and was just adequate. However they are only minor issues and didn't put me of the hotel. Staff at the hotel were very pleasant especially the concierge who was most helpful with any questions we had. As other people have mentioned the location was excellent for accessing Rome by foot and really enjoyed the area the Dei Mellini is in. There are three retaurants in the street and we went to Vitos the first evening and really enjoyed the food. I would certainly go back to this hotel and would recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Dei Mellini ...perfect Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: poipu67
Reviews.Content: On the Vatican side of the Tiber, it is much quieter. Dei Mellini is 10 min walk from Piazza de Popolo...12 minutes from the Spanish Steps. Good Breakfast...friendly staff. Just an excellent choice for Rome. Also the shopping on this side is much less expensive than near the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: drachirta
Reviews.Content: Well situated, reasonably easy walk to main attractions, comfortable rooms (if a little small), extremely welcoming and helpful staff, excellent breakfast buffet and good value- what more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful for those with a disability”
Reviews.Author: MarshieDublin
Reviews.Content: I saw the steps at the entrance but at the side there was a lift in what looked like a wooden panel. It opened with a switch and I was up the few feet almost as quickly as those on foot. The location was excellent and very near the Piazza Cavour. The Vatican was close by as were the Piazza Navono and Popolo. I loved the two bathrooms with one suited for disabilities. These facilities are excellent. the Hotel is quiet and warm and the staff are very friendly with plenty of helpful advice on local sites. The price secured on Voyage Prive was excellent as well. €115 p.n for two for a good room in central room was excellent value. This price was on a special deal for four nights from Voyage Privé.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: happyrelaxeddudes
Reviews.Content: In advance of my travel to Rome, I exchanged several emails with the person responding to the hotel's email (Ms. Gagliardi) regarding the availability of guides for private tours, the need for advance reservations at restaurants and other inquiries. Ms. Gagliardi arranged tours for us and gave us recommendations on restaurants. Upon arrival, the desk clerk confirmed the time and meeting point (lobby of hotel) for our adventures. The desk clerk also called taxis, gave us advice on tipping at Italian restaurants (a topic on which I am still confused) and actually called a restaurant for us when my lack of ability to speak Italian presented an obstacle to communication. The hotel property was lovely and the venue for the breakfast (which was included in the price) was contemporary and welcoming. However, the staff is the most impressive aspect of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluebell30
Reviews.Content: Booked whole trip using airmiles. Hotel very nice, friendly helpful staff, rooms spotless, no noise, breakfast fine without being wonderful, Don't have room service evenng meal - very small portions and lots of rolls with no butter! Bar (small in main foyer) serves a nice local Frascati at a very reasonable price. Walking distance if you are a walker to most of the major sites. DO book Vatican visit on the web and by-pass all the queues which are miles long and this in February. St Peter's Basillica is a must and for us, more WOW than the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Stevemcguinness1
Reviews.Content: Ideal location next to the river and easy walking distance to either Vatican city or Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Quiet area. Rooms are very good, staff multi lingual, friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good with plenty of choice. Bar is a let down with seating for only 6 people and limited choice so give it a miss and drink elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city break!”
Reviews.Author: JoandJon244
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel dei Mellini, Rome. It made our long weekend break even more enjoyable. The hotel is in a fantastic location and is walking distance to most of the major attractions. We walked to the Colosseum (45mins), the Pantheon (20mins), Trevi Fountain (20mins), Spanish Steps (20mins), The Vatican Museum (25mins), Stadio Olympico (45mins) and Castle of St Angelo from the hotel. We were lucky that we were able to walk, as it snowed quite heavily while we were in Rome and public transport was somewhat sporadic! The rooms are spacious and clean. The bathrooms are also a good size and very clean. Our lasting memory from the hotel was the comfort of the bed. It was fantastic and we both slept very well while there. We have contacted the hotel since returning home and have asked for the bed manufacturer (which they very kindly supplied) and are now on the hunt for a comparable mattress in the UK! The staff are very friendly and obliging. The breakfast is good. Internet access is very reasonable at 10Euros for three days.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Experience ( Maritizio was great )”
Reviews.Author: 151Gary
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here 21/01/12 for just one night and i wish we could have stayed longer. The Hotel was beautiful, had a great location and the best part was the staff. The man at reception Maritizio was just a joy to deal with. He was so frielndly not to mention the bar man also. So helpful. The Rooms were spotless and modern, all appliances worked and the breakfast was amazing, so much choice. I couldnt recommend this hotel enough, perfect for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel; professional, helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pasquilino
Reviews.Content: A top quality hotel in a great location - near the Vatican but also within walking distance (10mins) of via del corso and many of the most famous tourist attractions. The staff were very helpful and always available. The breakfast was also good. Our room was convenient and non-noisy with a very nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MemphisKat
Reviews.Content: This smallish boutique hotel is wonderfully located within walking distance of the Vatican, Spanish Steps, and Borghese Gardens and Gallery. The hotel staff was very helpful with great food recommendations, reservations, directions, etc. Nice bathroom. My only objection is no free Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: k_kov11
Reviews.Content: nice hospitality, great location and reasonble value for your purchase

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CanonballJoe
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel in Rome is difficult most months of the year, and prices throughout the city are much higher than I'm generally happy with. This hotel isn't cheap, but it is appropriately priced and a strong 4-star boutique type hotel. The hotel is in a good location to walk to most of the major areas. For our vacation, we utilized the public bus service which was convenient to the hotel for longer trips and found it convenient. The hotel is in excellent condition and appears to have had a recent remodelling. Our room was wonderful - great bed, bath, new furniture, new linens, flat screen TV, and what we liked the most - a small walk-in closet. Often I find that hotels with good facilities often have poor staff - the staff and management a the Dei Melline were great. We would definitely stay and would recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibchicago
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms and decor are terrific. Very good breakfast. Located in a quiet neighborhood. Front staff is friendly but not consistenly knowledgeable about tourist details on tours, etc. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Dei Melline Nov. 4-9th, 2011”
Reviews.Author: TravelerToRome
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for lodging while staying in Rome. Across the Tiber but the historic section can be reached in a short 5 to 10 minute scenic walk from the hotel. Hotel is located on a quieter street so not as much traffic noise as there is in other Rome hotels. The staff is attentive, professional, courteous and eager to provide superb customer service. The breakfast buffet is a good way to start off the day in Rome. Room was clean, stylish and comfortable. This is the best hotel I've stayed at yet while visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: Dav S
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here in Nov 2011. The hotel is in a superb location, with all major tourist attractions within walking distance, e.g. Vatican City approx 15 mins, Spanish Steps 10-15 mins, etc. The room was a good size and very clean, with a balcony facing the front of the hotel (tip - ask for a room facing the road as the views from the rooms facing the rear of the hotel are just bricks and mortar). The staff were simply faultless!! On our second morning at breakfast there was no freshly cut fruit (maybe due to us going down late for breakfast), a waiter noticed my wife wanted the fruit and so personally went into the kitchen and hand cut a huge bowl of fresh fruit just for her :-) it really made her day! I am a frequent traveller and have stayed at places such at The Bellagio and Beverley Wilshire to Rocco Forte's hotels and the Burj Al Arab, nevertheless the Hotel dei Mellini was a hotel I will always remember and recommend for anyone visiting the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel can't fault anything”
Reviews.Author: Phil-sellick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to everything but still in a nice quiet area. There are a few nice local restaurant in the street, and an amazing wine bar in piazza Cavour about 6 mins walk. Staff are brilliant, breakfast is very nice (including the hot stuff) and the bar is perfect for a pre and post dinner. Hotel is modern and very clean and rooms good size for Rome. I would say ideal for business and pleasure, the wifi is chargeable but is very fast compared to free ones, and the hotel had some good size meeting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, clean, relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011 and it was wonderful! The hotel is on the other side of the Tigris river, close to Villa Borghese Park which we spent a good portion of our arrival day at overcoming jet lag. It's about 1 1/2 miles from the Vatican, a simple bus ride to the Coliseum, only 2 blocks to the bus stop. The rooms were clean, but a little small which is typical of European hotels. The bathrooms had hair dryers and plenty of hot water. The hotel is in a very quiet neighborhood, a definite plus. I would highly recommend staying here, you'll enjoy it! The only minor complaint and it was true for all the American breakfasts at all the Italian hotels. The bacon is way undercooked, just above raw.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: Stephen G
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, great breakfast, great staff, good location, nice rooms!

Reviews.Title: “A haven of peace”
Reviews.Author: Barbibonbon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 very warm nights at the end of September. It was such a relief to walk back into a cool, quiet hotel after the hectic streets of Rome. Staff were excellent.They were friendly, polite and nothing was too much trouble.The room was spacious and had everything you need. I would definitely go back to this hotel if I return to Rome.The only area which could be improved was the breakfast. It was ok but I'd have liked a bit more choice. As other reviewers have said the location was excellent and most of the top sites were an easy walk.We used the bus to visit the Colloseum. It goes from the end of the street & only costs 1 euro.Also found the airport shuttle quick &convenient. Ours only took 6 so there was no driving all round the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: court123s
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very nice spacious rooms. It was a short 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and a lot of restaurants. The hotel itself is in a quiet neighborhood. The only thing that bothered us was of all the 6 cities we visited on this trip this was the only hotel that charged for the wireless Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Easily worth all 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Hudwit
Reviews.Content: I always run through the previous reviews before I put pen to paper and all I can really do here is to reiterate what most other people have already said. We took my Mum here for a 75th birthday present and it really couldn't have been more perfect. The location is in a quiet back street but is in a perfect location being equidistant between the Vatican area in one direction and 'Old Rome' over the river. We used taxis a few times but if we'd been on our own would have happily walked everywhere. Admit that the Colosseum is a bit of a hike though. Use the 35/70 IT taxis, seemed to be a real bargain, only 7-8 Euros to travel halfway across the city. If there are 2+ of you quite pointless using public transport. We used Airports-Shuttle to get to and from Fiumicino airport, bargain at 80 Euros return, about 40 minutes, brilliant service as well. Not a lot to see around the hotel in the evenings, something mentioned by a previous reviewer. However we soon found some very good restaurants locally; there are two in the same road as the hotel which were excellent. Hotel staff were faultless, the two ladies we dealt with at reception were quite wonderful. In a three night stay we managed to fit in all the main sights/sites. On last morning got a taxi down to the Trastevere area, worth a look to do something a bit different. Some superb old streets and churches, and a walk over to the Isola Tiberica in the middle of the River Tiber. If (!) you go to the Vatican imperative to get there early, the queues are catastrophic after mid morning. If you have to choose between St Peters Basilica and Sistine Chapel/museums (totally different entrances about 1km apart), go for the Basilica, jaw dropping. Also, don't miss the Pantheon under any circumstances. Superb hotel, superb city, I already want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: GMatthehotel
Reviews.Content: sort of a surprise, as it is a quiet side street location I wasnt sure what we were getting into. the lobby is very modern with a nice bar and everything you would expect. Rooms were large and good price for Rome. Buffet breakfast, well its ok, but have had better, the staff were hit and miss, those that were great, were really great, but they seemed pretty busy, could just be our timing. the little restaurant next door is outstanding, and really feels like the perfect Rome experience. would definately go back, just for sitting in the stunning roof top garden with a glass of wine. simply doesnt get better than that.

Reviews.Title: “"A Superb Hotel in an Ideal location"”
Reviews.Author: FoodandWinelover3
Reviews.Content: A City Break booked for December but postponed by snow until February, (Thanks to KIRKER Holidays they were Brilliant) this hotel was perfect. Just one block from the river it was easy to walk to all of the major attractions Rome had to offer. (even the Colosseum if you took your time). Our Room overlooked the street and was spacious and above all quiet,blackout curtains kept street lighting at bay. The buffet breakfast was really good ,authentic Italian (No Eggs & Bacon or sauerkraut) Fresh produce and Espresso served with a smile. Slightly off the tourist trail the area has some delightful family run Restaurants,Cafes and Bars within easy reach. With friendly and helpful staff we both had a wonderful time in Rome thanks to them. Definitely recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aff2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our way back from Sorrento. It was a great surprise!! The location is good and it is walking distance to many attraction such as The Spanish Steps, etc. The room we stayed was very modern and, even though it faced the street, it was not noisy at all. The hotel is on a side street really close to the river. We arrived there early and the reception was kind enough to check us in immediately. That was a big plus as we had only one more night in Rome. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant all round, cannot fault, will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was brilliant and all of staff were really helpful. Centrally located it was within walking distance of all the big sites and retail shops. Wifi was an extra but was very good. The roof terrace, gym and open air solarium were good additions. Our room was fully air conditioned with plenty of storage. Room service was quick too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: coalking
Reviews.Content: On arrival to our room there was a welcome of fresh fruit, a bottle of Prosecco and bottle of wine, and a lovely note wishingus a happy honeymoon. Which we thought was a lovely personel touch. The Hotel is in a good location easy walking distance to all sights, The staff were very friendly and were always very helpful and polite. We stayed in a suite which was very spacious clean, The roof top terrace was wonderful for sitting having a drink and relaxing before evening meal and resting weary legs. I cannot find a bad thing to stay about this Hotel it would be a pleasure to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean, well located and good service”
Reviews.Author: 813Mark_Bartlett813
Reviews.Content: A good hotel that is well situated for walking around the centre of Rome. Castel Sant Angelo is only 10 mins walk, St Peters Square only 15 and Piazzo Del Populo is about 10 mins also. My room was very spacious and clean, quiet at night and the service from front of house was excellent. A couple of words of warning though. If you're expecting a boutique hotel experience from their website you'll be a little disapointed - the photos there don't really represent the rooms. The bar is not very inviting and the breakfast room downstairs leaves something to be desired. When I returned in the evening I could have a drink on the roof but it had to be ordered in the lobby and brought up which I thought was a shame. This is a good hotel and well worth the money but with a little extra could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Abi81_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dei Millini from the 23-30 August 2011. You might think it's a little out of the way, but it's really close to the centre of Rome. It took us about 15 mins to walk to the Vatican, but it's a lovely walk by the river. The bridge across from the court house takes you straight in to Piazza Navona, which is a lovely place to sit and watch te world go by. The hotel itself was immaculate, our room was claened and beds made daily, we stayed in room 212 which was a deluxe double, we paid the extra as was our honeymoon. It was large, with a seating area, and the bed was a kingsize. Matress too hard for us...but that's a personal thing. Breakfast was cereal, rolls, pastrys, cheese, ham, scrambled eggs and bacon, fruit and cake. All constantly topped up and refreshed. We had fruit juice and tea and coffee...really couldn't fault it. The negative things...We did try room service once...didn't enjoy the meal at all, and was charged an 8 Euro surcharge for the privledge. There is a roof terrace, but this is small and doesn't have a view of anything. There was no bar on the roof terrace, so if you wanted a drink you needed to order it from the bar via the phone provided...but each order cost you the additional 8 Euro room charge service. Having said all that, if we returned to Rome, we would definitley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CateP42
Reviews.Content: Booked here by cruise line for 2 night pre-cruise stay. Neede the comfortable bed after long transatlantic flight. Room small but adequately furnished and very clean. Excellent breakfast included. Hotel has several interesting public spaces - rooftop sunning/sitting area, quiet conservatory, bar/lounge and sitting room with computer access. Desk staff very helpful. Good location for exploring much of central Rome on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenSC
Reviews.Content: For my boyfriend and I, our trip to Rome was a once in a lifetime opportunity. The location of the hotel was wonderful in that it was slightly off the beaten path, but close to the Vatican and to our favorite neighborhood of Trastevere (charming local area with FANTASTIC food). We were able to walk everywhere within the city walls for our entire stay with nothing being more than a 30 minute trek away. Upon arrival at the hotel, we had a warm welcome and received an upper level room with a wonderful view. The room was a good size and had been recently updated. There was even one evening upon returning to find a bottle of complimentary champagne they had provided for my boyfriend's birthday without saying anything to the staff. The breakfast in the morning was quite good with choices of breads, meats, fruits, granola, yogurt, and so on. I would have to say that the only "issue" we had (and actually may be what some are looking for) is that the guests were more on the retiree side and we are in our late 20s. All in all, the hotel was defineitely the cherry on the cake making our Rome experience an unforgettable one. I hightly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe they had good ratings!”
Reviews.Author: coleen_18
Reviews.Content: Depressingly dark, gloomy with employees that are either indifferent or rude. When asked driections about the port of Rome, Civitecchia, the day receptionist actually kept repeating the name when my husband said it ...to show how to correctly pronounce the port of Rome's name and was very arrogant about it. Sorry that we don't speak Italian. The building is circular with a middle opening so that every room window is facing all the others. Felt like I had to keep drapes closed all the time for privacy, and light coming into windows is limited. Don't know if building is slanted or what, but I felt very off balance there. If you only care about location, then it is a good location. Good luck if you're driving there which is what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round experience.”
Reviews.Author: JandAAE
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon and were more than happy with the experience. The staff were very welcoming on arrival and helpful throughout our stay. A couple of nice touches; we recieved a bottle of prosecco on arrival but also another the day of my wifes birthday. The room we stayed in (a superior double) was large and comfortable and very quiet, one great thing about the location of the hotel is how quiet the area was with no adverse noise. Breakfast is fine and there is plenty of choice from cereal to cooked eggs and bacon to pastries. The hotel is not centrally located but is also not far from all the major sights. Rome is such a beautiful place that walking for 10 minutes to an attraction seems no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel/location, a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaH09
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The Dei Mellini is a nice hotel in a good location. Some have reviewed that it's location is not so great. I don't actually know where they have got this from. I walked everywhere from the hotel only using the metro once when I went to Termini on my way back to the airport. The Vatican is about a 15 minute walk at a leisurely pace and the Colloseum being the furthest attraction, but even then it only took about 40 minutes and as Rome is such a lovely place to walk around with it's old architecture cobbled streets, it was nice. When visiting the Colloseum you could even plan it so that you take in other sights along the way. I started at the Pantheon, then Piazzo Navona and then Campo de foiri before heading onto the Colloseum and apparently the Colloseum is better visited in the afternoon as there is less queuing then (I was informed by some brits who lived and worked in Rome). STAFF: Staff were very good. Service was always with a smile. Reception very helpful and always done what they could should you need to ask for anything. No negatives whatsoever. ROOM/HOTEL: Unfortunately this is where the few drawbacks are. First off the rooms were kept very clean so this was not an issue. I paid for a superior double which turned out to be a very small room with a bad view (a brick wall) and just a single shower, no bath. because of the location of the room, i had to have lights on at all times of the day when in the room, there really was no sunlight. The bed was very large and also very firm so if that's your thing, happy days but i found it a little too firm. The hotel does have a roof terrace but no bar there which I assumed from what I read in the hotel write up and it doesn't exactly look like it does in the photos. FOOD: The breakfast was of a continental affair with the addition of some bacon and scrambled eggs. As i knew it was mainly continental when I booked, it wasn't a problem for me but for those that wish to have the type of breakfast you would find at resorts, this could possibly be a drawback. Saying that, the food that was on offer was always stocked up and the breakfast room always very well attended. It really is unfortunate about the few drawbacks and because of those that I mentioned, I'm sorry to say that I'd have to say it was a good 3 star hotel and not the four that it currently holds. Really is a shame because all in all, it is a very nice hotel but I just think it lacks that little extra to make it a solid four star. To that end, if you could happily put up with the drawbacks mentioned above then this is a very good choice for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: QueensLander_Tours1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel while part of a QueensLander Tours small group tour to Italy. Granted, this hotel is a little out from the city centre, but not too far, just on the other side of the river. Maybe a 20 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, as I recall. It's also fairly close to Castel Sant'Angelo. I don't think QueensLander uses this hotel anymore due to the lack of central location, but if I were going to Rome again on my own, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here. The lobby area is not big or fancy, but its plenty nice and comfortable. There was also a computer available for checking email in a side sitting area. They also had a boardroom-style conference room available for business meetings, etc. I also found the staff here to be friendly and helpful. My room was clean and comfortable. I would describe it similar to staying at a nice Marriott Inn in the States. As I recall, the bathrooms had Italian marble, as well as speakers in the shower to hear the news or music from your television. Most of the inside rooms of this hotel faced onto an interior courtyard, so I wouldn't expect any kind of great view from this hotel, but if you're not worried about that in particular, this hotel is plenty fine. The continental breakfast was nice, with just about anything you would want. I don't remember there being eggs and bacon particularly, but there was cereal, toast, croissants, yogurt, fruit, etc. Definitely enough to get your day going well. This was more of a working neighborhood, so not much going on in the evening close by, but there was a little bar down the street for a beer, hamburger, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: manchesterJ
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have recently returned from a four night stay at the Dei Mellini. Following the advice of another reviewer, we caught the Airport Shuttle bus to Piazza Cavour for 8 euros each and then walked to the hotel in about 4 minutes! The staff were very welcoming, the room was spacious and beautifully presented and nothing was too much trouble for the housekeeping staff. The breakfast was served in the elegant newly refurbished dining room and was far from shoddy.It was a good continental breakfast which kept us going for most of the day! The area is quiet but within easy reach of most of the main places of interest, we walked everywhere and loved exploring the small streets where we found beautiful little churches hidden away. The roof terrace was a lovely place to relax after a busy day in the city. We caught the bus back to the airport and were so pleased that we saved so much money on transfers. We couldn't fault the hotel and if ever we return to Rome we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class..........”
Reviews.Author: Mosschops27
Reviews.Content: From the airport it's only 8 euros by the SIT Bus Shuttle to Piazza Cavour, but you'll soon realise that people here are not as orderly when queueing as you may be used to so stand your ground or you will be left at the airport for a long time. From Piazza Cavour it's then just a short 3 - 4 minute walk to the hotel. Situated in a fairly quiet location just on the Vatican City side of the River this is an excellent base to explore the many must see sights around Rome. The welcome on arrival was very friendly and we were immediately given a map with key locations marked including Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain & Piazza Navona. We had opted for a junior suite, which was on the 5th floor just below the rooftop terrace & gym. Spacious & comfortable throughout, the little touches made this hotel stand out from others we have stayed in, including turning the bed down each evening, excellent housekeeping and even more of a surprise was the complimentary bottle of Prosecco provided on my birthday. Breakfast was a standard buffet including cereals, fruit, yoghurt & pastries - adequate and sets you up to venture out for the day. We would recommend that you cover Rome on foot as there is so much to see everywhere you go. From the hotel its only a 15 - 30 minute walk to most of the major sights, including the exceptional Vatican City, Spanish Steps (beware of the Indian men offering the women a rose - it isn't free, instead they follow this up with quite an intimidating hard sell to get money from you), Trevi Fountain, Pantheon & Colosseum. Also make sure you get away from the hustle & bustle for the afternoon & make your way to Villa Borghese, a beautiful & tranquil park which includes a zoo. There are restaurants close to the hotel. Be prepared to pay a lot if you choose to dine on Piazza Navone, which is worth a visit even though the food is no better than many other places throughout the city. Our favourite restaurant was Life on Via della Vite. Hotel dei Mellini is an excellent hotel and one we will stay at again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: LeicsPotter
Reviews.Content: Contrary to some reports I had read, the staff at dei Mellini could not have been more helpful. On the evening of day one I managed to crack a tooth (don't ask!). In the morning I asked at reception if they knew a good local dentist. By the time we had finished breakfast they had located the nearest surgery and booked me an appointment for within the hour...fantastic! I had been dreading my dental problem spoiling our holiday but by lunchtime it was as if nothing had happened. Dei Mellini is just a stroll away from St Peter's Square and across the river all the major attractions are within walking distance, although some may prefer to catch the 87 bus to go as far as the Colloseum. The hotel is in a quiet area but in all the surounding streets are cafes, restaurants and shops. Having the Carabinieri office on the same street is reassuring, not that we ever felt threatened in Rome. The room was cool, clean, well decorated and the bed large and firm. The bathroom had bath, shower over, wash basin, loo and bidet...not much else needed. A regular supply of clean, soft towels and soaps etc meant we never had to "chase" for anything. The continental breakfast was extensive and well looked after and the breakfast room, though quite small, never over crowded. They serve breakfast from 6.30 to 11 so there is plenty of time for all the guests to come and go. If you can't get to all the sights then "don't miss" the Pantheon, Forum Romano (next to Colloseum), Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Castel Saint Angelo (just down from the hotel) One tip: if a middle aged guy in a car stops and asks for directions to the Vatican, then engages you in conversation about his work in high fashion DON'T buy a handbag from him! He stopped us twice with the same "routine" and only sped off the second time when he recognised us from 2 days before!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 2italophiles
Reviews.Content: If you like to walk, seeing the sights from this clean, courteous, comfortable 4 star is a great choice. Located between the Vatican and the Spanish Steps, all of the important sights and monuments are easily reached on foot. For those unfamiliar with Rome, an excellent small-group walking tour can be arranged on-line and meets informally at the Campo dei Fiori. An english speaking guide will insure that you leave with a basic backround in all the marvels of this historic city.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: DavisSunflower
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a month in Italy. Our trip started with 5 days in Rome and we stayed at the Hotel Dei Mellini with two other couples. All of us were very pleased with the hotel and our rooms. The beds were comfortable, linens were of high quality, and the service was excellent. Our rooms were kept spotless by a wonderful housekeeping staff, and the people at the front desk were all extremely helpful. Breakfast was one of the best we had on the whole trip, with a wide variety of cereals, fruits, breads, rolls, cold cuts and cheeses. There was a small bar in the hotel lobby where you could get a drink or a light snack at any time of the day or night, and there is also a computer available in the lobby for checking email, making reservations, printing boarding passes, etc. The only downside is that you are on the other side of the river from most of the sites, but it is an easy walk over the Ponte Cavour. Be sure to eat at Vito's just across the street from the hotel while you are there - best filet we have ever eaten.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon - Serviceable Hotel but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: jdprofile
Reviews.Content: While the staff was nice and the room was clean enough I would not recommend this hotel unless you get a good price. The reasons are as follows: its in a relatively out of the way location in a business district, the TV sucks with only a couple English channels, the fixtures in the bathroom are very budget (one of those fake marble sinks with the pre-formed depression for the soap – the airport bathroom quality faucet – one measly bar of soap – you get the idea), our view was a brick wall, the continental breakfast (included) was shoddy and the breakfast room is like a prison cafeteria with no windows. Don’t let anyone try to convince you it’s a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at Dei Mellini”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAdy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Dei Mellini is in a wonderful location. You can easily walk to the Spanish Steps (which is also one of the more exclusive shopping areas), Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Augustus' Mausoleum, and Castel Sant'Angelo among many other attractions. The hotel was very clean, the staff was more than helpful (especially Marco the bartender!), and it is on a pretty quiet street. The rooftop is also a nice spot to have a pre-dinner glass of wine, and speaking of dinner, there are quite a few good restaurants within easy walking distance. We would definitely stay there again, and will suggest it to friends and family who might be going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Rome Hotel but unfortunately witha big unpleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: virtej
Reviews.Content: In the beginning we thaught that it was a good hotel, central, close to tourist attractions, nice personal at the reception. But then the nasty surprise: we had a bottle of whisky in our room just opened in the first evening drinking a small glass after a long day; next evening the bottle diasppeared!!! The bad thing is that the hotel personal did not believe us and that stealing from our room was for them just like nothing happened, because they could not explain how. The worst followed: the last evening we found our bottle half empty in the room with a letterfrom the manager that they found the bottle behind the bed! Worst behavior from them. They cover up the stealing from the hotel rooms. Never go there. Never> And if you plan to go, be cautios with what you leave in the room. They use to steal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: amieduvin
Reviews.Content: Dei Mellini was the hotel we stayed at for our pre-cruise tours. It was located in an area where we could walk to most places. It was clean and updated. The roof top terrace was wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Inspired to return”
Reviews.Author: Stargazer89
Reviews.Content: It's not often that I put keys to keyboard and put in a review. However we stayed in a suite at the start of June booked through BA. I will get the few gripes out of the way, internet access 4 euro for 45 minutes, 8 euro for a day. In this day and age a bit of a let down, continental breakfast with no toast making facilities, no hot drinks facilities in the room and pay TV. However if you can live with those issues then this maybe the place to stay. The staff to a person were great during our 3 night stay, nothing was too much trouble. They helped with my lost passport even offering a translation service at the police station if I got stuck with the police, got the numbers for the embassy for me as I had out of date information, they even offered to ring the embassy for me to find out what I needed to do, . Good restaurant recommendations based on our requirements and meal choices. Help with online check in and printing out of boarding passes. Room very clean with a nice large firm bed, no extraneous noises at night. There was an ipod docking station with speaker, great for listening to podcasts before going out. Roof terrace was also quiet and peaceful being the 6th floor with a small gym attached. Good quiet location, 10 minutes to Lepanto (metro station), 15 mins to each of St Peters Square, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navonna. Less than 10 minutes to Castelo San Angelo. We walked from Republica via the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and Piazza Navonna back to the hotel without difficulty. The Coliseum, Palatine and Capitoline Museums are an easy Metro ride away via Lepanto. Would I go back? Definitely. It is one of the few hotels I have stayed at that I would go back to rather than trying to find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: Harrogatedazza
Reviews.Content: Thanks to reviews on Trip Advisor we chose Dei Mellini for a long weekend in Rome and we were not disappointed. We were upgraded to a suite on arrival so it would seem ungrateful to comment on the lack of natural daylight as it was a first floor inside room but since it was only for sleeping it was not a problem and it was comfortable and spacious. The shower was over the bath with the usual clingy curtain but the location of the hotel was brilliant! 15 minutes walking distance to the Vatican in one direction or Piazza Navona in another or the Spanish Steps. On top of this the staff were so patient, helpful and friendly. Price wise I cannot compare with other hotels as this looked good and was in our budget. It was not a bargain but did not feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Patriots4
Reviews.Content: Read up on all the reviews on TripAdvisor and would have to side with the positives. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful. The West-bank location did mean that the traffic didn't interfere with our sleeping, but the Aircon did and it was only when we pushed the thermostat up to the max that it turned it off ( no other obvious way to do it ! ) and we were able to get a good sleep. On the location front, I believe it's well-placed to hit all the major attractions and, whilst it is slightly farther to the Metro ( at the Spanish Steps ) it's not too much of a hike and this gives you access to much more. The only drawback we saw was the existence of shops / supermarkets to "stock-up" on your own supply of beer / soda coz the mini-bar was really expensive ( as was the over-the-bar prices ). Also, finding a good choice of restaurants ( reasonably priced ) was a bit of a chore. Overall the short-break holiday was very enjoyable and I'd DEFINITELY recommend the Dei Mellini hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, very helpful staff, quiet location but close to all the sights - ideal.”
Reviews.Author: JulesV17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Hotel dei Mellini on our first ever trip to Rome. The hotel is in a quiet side street very close to both the Ponte Cavour and Ponte Margherita bridges over the Tiber and 20 minutes walk from the Vatican City. All the staff are very friendly, spoke excellent English and would do anything they could to make your stay comfortable. Our [standard] double room was large & very comfortable although the bed was a little hard for my personal taste. Housekeeping came in every day. There was a well stocked mini bar & the prices weren't over the top compared to prices locally. The bathroom was large with an excellent shower, large towels, hairdryer - everything you needed. The excellent buffet breakfast was of a continental style, with cheese, cold meats, fruit, pastries, cereals etc and hot food ( bacon & eggs) available on request. snacks, light meals etc were available either from the small bar or from room service and although a little pricey (€16 for a club sandwich) was very tasty. The staff were able to book tours for you should you wish (we used Carrani Tours) & are able to recommend local restaurants. We found the location of the hotel ideal - it is in the Prati district which being across the river tends to be quieter but is still only 20 mins walk from many of the many sights (Vatican, Piazza dei Popolo, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Campo fe Fiori) depending on how you choose your route & where you cross the river. There are fewer restaurants in the area although we would recommend the American themed T-Bone Station (fantastic steaks & lovely staff, quite lively) and Antica Trattoria "Memmo" - delicious traditional italian food and very reasonably priced. On the whole we found the hotel to be excellent value for money and should we return to Rome (my coins are in the Trevi Fountain so here's hoping) we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: Lockemup1
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini Hotel is certainly one of the more comfortable hotels that we have stayed in. We found the reception staff so very helpful and polite. Nothing seemed too much for them. It was my wifes' birthday and we were certainly surprised when a chilled bottle of wine was left in our room on our return from a day out. Breakfast is sufficient to get the day started, but do not expect bacon and eggs. The only thing missing was tea/coffee making facilities, which is a 'nice to have'. The hotel is well positioned, with the Vatican within walking distance and the other attractions not too far away. If you are spending at least 3 days in Rome, a travel card for the metro and buses is well worth the price. The metro has 2 main lines so will not be confusing. If you are flying to Rome Caimpino airport, do not use the Terravision bus service. It maybe cheap, but they are so dis-organised. The queues were so long that by the time we got to our hotel we were totally exhausted. Going back was even worse. Pick up a white taxi. their fares are around 35 euro to Rome hotels - but ask before you get in their cabs. There are some 'sharks' about. This is really a lovely hotel and when we go back to Rome, we will certainly be staying at the Dei Mellini again. Well done to Management and staff. You made our visit one to remember! The Watts family, Colchester, Essex.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MJButler76
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Rome where we stayed at the Dei Mellini. Firstly a quick hint. The Hotel is just 5 minutes (if that) walk from the Piazza Cavour. Why is this important you may ask. well the Airport 'Skybus' has a stop in the Piazza Cavour and is Eight Euro's for a dingle to & from the airport. This is much closer than the Airport Express Train & Metro Combo if you are using public transport and nearly half the price (15 Euros for Train Metro & a longer walk at the end). So onto the hotel. Check staff were very friendly and helpful with Map's and local bus routes for the popular tourist attractions. Room was great, nice & clean with a good shower. Wardrobe / Drawer space was fine for the weekend, there was a hairdryer and safe and a well stocked, if slightly costly minibar). Breakfast was continental or you could pay for cooked. We stuck with the continental and there were plenty of options including cereal, yoghurt, fruit, rolls with ham/cheese and also some yummy pastries. All well stocked and looked after by a team of 3 or 4 table staff. Location. We didn't know much about Rome before we left. In a nut shell you've got the Tiber River running North South slightly to the left of centre. To the West of the Tiber is The Vatican with St Peters square etc and to the south you have Colloseum and 'Old Rome' is pretty much between the two. The Dei Mellini is closer to The Vatican, just west of the river - about 20 minutes walk to St Peters / Vatican Museum and is within 25 minutes of the Spanish Steps. So, if you know Rome this should give you a good idea. For us it was just fine as we bought a Roma Pass and could jump on the bus to the further away places then walk back to hotel stopping at places of interest on the way back. All in all a great stay in a great hotel. The team at the Dei Mellini also let us print our boarding cards for the return flight and arranged a late check-out on our room. Nice touches to make us feel that little bit special

Reviews.Title: “treated warmly, and greatly helpful”
Reviews.Author: Kom56
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very comfortable, centrally located, and helpful. the concierge was amazing in helping us with a problem with a car service, booked from home. She went above and beyond to try to resolve the issue for us.Lesson learned: let the hotel book services for you, not the Internet. we would definitely return to the Dei Mellini.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: nath2chris6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an excellent area, you can walk to all the major attractions. There is nothing to do at the hotel witch forces you to get out and do stuff. All you'll need is a map and some comfortable shoes. We even walked to St peters Square. The staff was very helpful and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutetly Fantastic Place To Stay! Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: lukehopper123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dei Mellini for 2 nights and booked through the British Airways website getting all of our flights and hotel transfers included. We paid extra for 2 suites at the hotel via the website and found these to be very clean and very comfortable and would recommend the suites to anyone wanting to book at the Dei Mellini! Upon arrival we were checked in by a very friendly and helpful young gentleman and had our bags carried up to our rooms. Both suites were very spacious and we even had a complimentary bottle of champagne and bowl of different fruits in each room which we found to be a really nice addition. The breakfast was ok but nothing exciting. Just your average continental italian breakfast. The hotel recommended eating at a lovely restaurant called 'Vitos' just down the road from the hotel. However quite expensive, the food is really good and we ended up going back on the second night of our stay due to the food been so wonderful so would recommend this restaurant if you go to Rome. Room service and the hotel bar are expensive however most of the bars or restaurants in Rome are expensive so this is just typical for Italy. Our rooms at the hotel were cleaned every day and our bed sheets changed every day which again was a nice addition. The hotel rooms we had even had a minibar which had a wide variety of alcoholic and not alcoholic beverages which are kept chilled and refreshing after a long day sightseeing! The hotel is situated about a 15 minute walk to the Vatican and about 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain however if your wanting to visit the Colosseum i suggest you do what we did and buy 24 hour tickets for the 'City Sightseeing Buses' where you can get off and on as you please all day. Overall, if your thinking about booking to stay at this hotel i would highly recommend it! Like yourselves i read all of the reviews on tripadvisor for the Dei Mellini and was unsure whether to book when reading the bad reviews however booked up and could not fault the hotel personally! If anyone has any questions about the hotel - please dont hesitate to contact me and i will be happy to tell you all i know! But if your wanting to book up to Rome and dont know where to stay, do try this hotel, it is great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jm1ne0
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights as part of a trip booked through EuropeanDestinations.com. Staff was friendly and helpful, room was well appointed, spotless, comfortable, and spacious. Would highly recommend to anyone who wants to be near shopping, the vatican, old Rome, and all the other sites that are within walking distance. The only downside was a lack of free WiFi but as I came to find out, that is the norm in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Mellini? NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: burkinab
Reviews.Content: I was staying for three nights, the reason i stayed in Rome was for business. When i arrived i was checked in as quick as possible, where the breakfast room was or any other information which i would have appreciated was not given. I got a map of the city and that was it, without a smile or any gesture that made me feel welcome. The only person that did a little more than the absolte minimum of service was the technician rebooting my internet connection since it did not work in the first place. Unfortunately this wasn`t of any use, because the resolution of the screen in my room was such that it was impossible to read anything on it. It`s fine for television but not if you pay 5 Euro`s extra and then one is not able to use what was payd for. Nowadys any selfrespecting 4 star Hotel offers WIFI, whether free or not, this should be a standart, especially when attending business meetings in the city and a fast connection is vital. On the second day when i came back to the hotel at about 4 pm the door to my room was wide open, not a soul was around to explain or what so ever. Luckily nothing was missing. I had my expensive equipment with me that day. But it could have been otherwise. To ad injury to insult, when ordering a taxi via the hotel one has to be aware that the hotel is cashing in as well on the fare. I was aware of this, but if you have luggage and you need a taxi early in the morning, that`s the opportunity you are left with. Before i checked out i made sure to call a taxi by myself. While i was in the bathroom for a minute, the concierge was already trying to make a deal with the taxi driver hoping to get some extra cash. That`s what the taxi driver told me when we drove of. Mellini, never again! It`s not my first time in Rome or in Italy but for 150 Euros a night one can expect better than that.

Reviews.Title: “A good option that (just) meets expectations”
Reviews.Author: agsLisboa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel from 29/10 to 2/11, 2010. I choose it as a backup as my first choice was overbooked, Location: having been to Rome on several different occasions it is difficult to pick an Hotel that doesn't have some points of interest within walking distance. This one is very well located and you can walk to the Vatican area and Piazza Navona, Via Del Corso, Piazza de Spagna without much effort. Rooms: Clean and large. Service: Nice and friendly Breakfast: this is really the weak spot. Really bad and bellow standard for a 4*Lux (that's the rating they have on the front door). From the juices (watery and artificial) to the general offer both in quality and diversity this is a 2* (at the best) quality breakfast. Given the imense offer one has in Rome I really would suggest you look elsewhere, not that this is a bad hotel (far from it - you most likely will not have major issues during your stay) but you won't have any lasting memories of it either. And for me memories and experiences that's what travelling is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BobSanJuan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this excelent hotel for 1 night which is a "sister" of the Hotel Borgognoni, which we were supposed to stay at for 4 nights. This hotel was very nice clean & modern with all amenities, but on the other side of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bordenbunch
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three week 25th anniversary trip to Italy. I just want to qualify this review by saying that we travel for business over 90 nights a year and spend a lot of time in hotels. We usually don't take the time to write reviews unless its "outstanding" one way or another. The Dei Mellini hotel was a truly wonderful experience for us! From the street, the Dei Mellini is a quite little boutique hotel in the Prati district of Rome that you have to be looking for to find. What a bonus this turned out to be! While just slightly off of the very busy and noisy main streets this sophisticated little hotel is perfectly located in between the Vatican area and the touristy area of the Spanish Steps, Borghese Gardens, Piazza Nuovono. About a fifteen minute walk in any direction will land you at one of these sites. We had been forewarned that room sizes in Europe were significantly smaller than those in the US so we were prepared for tiny. When we walked into our room we were surprised at the spacious (not huge) and well appointed room with a huge bathroom all decked out in marble. The bed was super comfortable and the bedding was luxurious. The little touches in the room like slippers, a refrigerator and a welcome fruit plate were very appreciated. Nightly turn down service was a nice touch! More importantly, the staff of the Dei Mellini was friendly, went out of their way to be helpful and recognized us by name after only one day. A very special Thank You to Marco the bartender who continually took time to answer all our questions about Rome and was happy to recommend local restaurants and gelato places that were amazing and frequented by the locals. There were just two small things that could be considered negative. The air conditioning for the building was shut down on October 1st and Rome happened to be quite warm while we were there. Our window faced an inside courtyard that was used by all of the hotels smokers. Our choice was a warm room or a smoky room. Fortunately, evenings cooled off and the smokers went to bed early so it didn't impact us too terribly. Second, we felt that the breakfast (which was not included in our rate) was a little pricey at 20 EU per person. We opted to frequent the little coffee/pastry shop across the street for about 4 EU a person. I can't say enough about the location! We were all over the city and took several prearranged tours where we were able to chat about our accommodations with fellow travelers. While not convenient to Termini Train Station (and most of our trip was by rail through Italy) it was worth the cab fare to stay at the Dei Mellini. The area was safe, with a police station just down the block and well lit. The area was busy but not chaotic. There were many wonderful restaurants and a grocery store within a four block radius. We have no problem highly recommending this hotel to future travelers! On a side note, two other recommendations not related to the Dei Mellini. First, We used romecab.com to transfer from the airport. OUTSTANDING and reasonable! We were met by a driver with our name on a sign and escorted to his Mercedes Benz cab. He had us at our hotel in just 40 minutes and it only cost 45 EU. Well worth it after an overnight flight! Second, The best time to visit the Vatican is early Sunday Morning. We arrived in Saint Marks Square at 8:00 a.m. and it was us and literally a handful of people. We attended mass at one of the side altars in English and then roamed the church without crowds. The day before, we were standing 20 deep in front of Michaelangelos Pieata. What a gift to see it on Sunday morning with no one else there. Tour buses started pulling up around 10:30 a.m. as we were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Good central comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinksHarpenden
Reviews.Content: Hotel bedrooms excellent, large and beautifully decorated. Dressing gowns supplied. Communal areas small, but adequate if sightseeing all day. Breakfast not very exciting, but adequate, nothing hot. Room service very expensive (8 Euros on top of order), suggestion - buy at supermarket and use bedroom fridge. Excellent situation for all of Rome's attractions. No restaurant in hotel for evening meal. therefore no pressure to not try local restaurants, of which there are lots. The local streets are very peaceful in the evenings to wander about. Good restaurant we discovered just around corner from hotel in Via Giovanni Pierluigi da Palestrina 35- Trattoria Della Barchetta. Food excellent and not too expensive. Popular with locals. Menu was in Italian, but English speaking staff very helpful in explaining it all. Need to book, as we couldn't get in on first visit; Tel: 06 320 45 03.

Reviews.Title: “First room assigned was awful-a view of other room in a rectangular design!”
Reviews.Author: Squirt95
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a flight from Atlanta at 0715. I know the check-in time was listed as 1400, but most international will allow earlier check-ins if the rooms are available (check-out time is 1200). As long as we had to sit in the lobby waiting, we figured we would get a decent room. One of the smaller and absolutely no view rooms in the hotel which reeked of smoke. It was sickening-even the CLEAN bed linens smelled. We determined the maid must have smoked in the room. We were able to get another room the next day which was larger and was fine and didn't smell like cigarette smoke.. Some of the staff do not speak acceptable English-very difficult to communicate. I was really surprised that there were no vending machines or ice machines on the premises (had to get ice from the bar between hours of 1100 and 2300). Also not provided with iron/ironing board. Was told it was Italian law that doesn't permit irons. Yet, they allow SMOKING!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location. Expensive.”
Reviews.Author: MississaugaMoe
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Dei Mellini in Rome is conveniently located so that all major tourist attractions are within easy walking distance. The hotel is clean and nice, but a bit expensive. Internet charges are exhorbitant. The breakfast was OK --- nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean and friendly Hotel and a great location for a walking tour of Rome”
Reviews.Author: AndrewSYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to add my support to the comments which were important when we selcted this Hotel. The staff were very friendly and dealt quickly with the two small issues we had. They were very helpful with advice. The hotel is clean, tidy and well presented and easy walking distance from most of the key tourist spots. If you like a cup of tea in your room then you will need to take your own kettle. If there was a pool and or sauna/Spa it would have been perfect for our holiday. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean, friendly, highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lari77
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the internet are true. The hotel is very clean, friendly and english speaking representatives. They helped in planning dinners, places to go see, transportation services. It was a clean, cool, aircondition hotel. The breakfast was fresh and enjoyable. The restaurant VICTORS that was recommended is a must to visit. Dei Mellini is in perfect locatin to tourist. Most attractions are within walking distance, if it not the bus is right on the corner. The kind staff will give you perfect directions to get to local places. The rooms were confortable and large. The bathroom is modern and clean. We had 8 people staying here (3 rooms) all of us loved it!! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Brumingham
Reviews.Content: The staff here were second-to-none with an excellent knowledge of the local area from walking routes to bus routes, they could direct you to your location. The hotel itself is located in the 'Vatican' district of the city, being about a 20 minute walk from Vatican State. There are also plenty of restaurants within the immediate vicinity. The room was of a good size with an en-suite that was checked twice a day by the cleaning staff. The detail paid by them was exceptional, for example wrapping up a phone charger that was on the side to noticing habits with the duvets and making the beds accordingly. The breakfast served is a standard continental. The only thing I could've wanted more was some facilities in the hotel itself. Whilst it has some internet points and a sun terrace on the roof, the bar was far pricier than walking down the road to an actual bar. That said it had no impact that a throughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Oseledec63
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughters and I spent five days touring Rome with Hotel Dei Mellini as base. It was perfect. The hotel is a short walk to the Sistine Chapel, the Tiber, and for my daughters, shopping, pizza (the best in the world) and gelato (also the best in the world). The rooms are clean, modernized, and comfortable. I especially liked the balcony view the dome of St. Peter's Basilica. The hotel staff is friendly, multi-lingual, accommodating, but not intrusive. And the hotel is also fifty feet from a fabulous place to eat. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet hotel in great location, just a few wee gripes....”
Reviews.Author: LadyLungley
Reviews.Content: Lovely, quiet hotel which we thought was in a great location. Just over the river, not far from the Vatican. You are still near enough to all the attractions to be able to walk to them but because you are just the other side of the river, you feel that you are out of the hustle and bustle which was quite nice. Breakfast buffet was good, all your usual continental breakfast stuff. Our room was nice but really seemed to be lacking in something? It was a bit soul-less and maybe a few picture or two on the wall would've helped, it was just very plain for a 4 star hotel. We also found that sometimes we were treated like we were being a bit of an inconvenience (however this was only by the one member of staff on the reception desk and whilst we know it was nothing personal, it can be a bit off-putting to be served by someone with a bit of a "I'm way too cool to be doing this job" attitude). The breakfast room staff though were very nice and helpful and were happy to get you anything you asked for. Also, as I had booked a special non refundable room rate, I had to pay online at the time of reservation which I did so immediately with my credit card details. However, when we checked out, we were told that we had been charged twice by mistake but the accounts deparment were aware of it and my credit card would be refunded soon. This wasn't a huge problem as we did receive what seemed like a genuine apology. I did think it a bit odd though when we were then asked if we had anything out of the minibar. We said that we'd had 2 small bottles of coke from the minibar and were then charged 8 euros!! We dont have a problem paying for stuff that we've had but bearing in mind that we had just been told that £400 had unnecessarily been billed to our credit card because of an error on the hotel's part, it would've been a nice gesture to maybe say "you know what, we wont charge you for the 2 cokes - thats the least we can do as we've taken double the money for the room when we shouldn't have." Hey, maybe its just me but as I work in customer service, thats probably what I would've done. We might not have been charged had I made them aware of how I felt however we really did need to leave the hotel to catch our flight so I wasn't able to make my feelings known.

Reviews.Title: “Superb boutique hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: 150aerobat
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite as we were travelling with our teenage daughter. Superb hotel located on the Vatican side of the river but within walking distance of the Metro and all the Rome sights. Very friendly staff - easy check-in, given information on buses and tourist sights. Very nice suite, very comfy beds and a tv in both rooms. Good ensuite facilities, mini bar and quiet air con. Modern and pleasant lounges next to reception. Cold buffet breakfast provided and with a good selection - we left full. Two good Italian restaurants nearby and a steak house - filled with locals so must be good. Also Gustos restaurant just over the bridge. Easy walk to all of Rome's sights and the Vatican City. Basillica is open daily from 7am to 7 pm - possibly closed on Wednesday due to the Pope giving a Mass audience. Go along just after 5:30pm and there are no queues - its also free. Any delays are due to security checking of people carrying rucksacks through the archway scanners! Access to museums and Sistine Chapel is 15 euros or 8 euros for a child. Book a timed reservation before arriving in Rome on the Vatican web site then you can skip the queue. The tourist guides/ticket touts will greet you like long lost friends but they are a waste of money charging 45 euros per person. You can buy an official guide once inside for a fraction of the price, same deal at the Colleseum. Anyway - a great little gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAJOHU
Reviews.Content: Once finally arriving at the hotel after a slightly tortuous journey, I was very pleased to have arrived and met with friendly helpful staff. On being welcomed by the staff I was presented with a map and a few of the local sites were pointed out which was useful. The porter on escorting us up to our room was also helpful and told us that there was a restaurant next door if we fancied something to eat, although after eating there at a later date I am glad I ate elsewhere on the first night. The hotel is found in a quiet location close by to the river Tiber close to the Castel Sant Angelo and a 10 minute walk to the Vatican City. It is also close by to a number of restaurants and it is easy to get to the other sites in Rome although walking in the heat of July was at times uncomfortable. Our room had air conditioning and had plenty of space. The bathroom was clean and well equipped. The beds were comfortable and it was hard not to sleep well, especially with the quiet location of the hotel and the lack of noise from the streets outside. The breakfasts were ordinary but were sufficient to fill you up at the start of the day. The coffee was good and the waiting staff would knock you up an espresso if you asked. There is a bar in the hotel and a mini bar in the rooms but due to the cheap wine and beer available from the local convenience stores, which at times were difficult to find, we never used either. Overall the stay was very good and the staff able to assist with any questions or any other problems that we had. Would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay there again if I was to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “what a fantastic place rome is”
Reviews.Author: barry098
Reviews.Content: we have just stayed at the mellini in rome what a great place.It was partners birthday and we had a fantastic time the only thing that would of made the hotel room better was tea and coffee making facilities it would of been nice to have a drink when you get back from a day sightseeing.But overall would recommend this to friends,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the quiet side of the Tiber River”
Reviews.Author: Kaybers45
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Dei Mellini were great. they were very helpful and pleasant. The hotel is very modern and clean. Great thick towels! Since it is on the other side of the river, it is a bit of a walk to the "hotspots" but my husband liked the fact that is was quiet at night, and it was only about a ten minute walk to the Spanish Seps, 15 to the Pantheon or Trevi Fountain. We took the public bus to the Colloseum, which would have been a 45 min walk. Busses were very easy to use, as is all of the public transportation in Italy.. Wi fi was expensive, but the TV had internet capability for a modest charge. I would reccomend this hotel highly

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I love this place! The staff...”
Reviews.Author: Votenetti
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this place! The staff was amazing, friendly, and always one step ahead of what we needed or wanted. They would voluntarily call and find out anything without us even asking! The devore of the hotel is much newer then most in Rome. We were a bit worried about this, but when we arrived it was contemporary and comfortable. Without being "new age" The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. A lot bigger than we expected. We never heard a peep from our neighbors even though the floor was full. The neighborhood is very quiet. It's outside the major tourist areas but still well within walking distance of anything you like. We walked to the vactican our first day while we waited for our room to be ready(early flight). As you walk out of the hotel to the left there is a great restaurant. We ate there 3 of our 4 nights in Rome! Worth every penny and more. We will definately be going back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: nbiller
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, great food (although the complimentary breakfast bar is lacking hot food). Entire hotel was clean, staff was always friendly. Drinks at the bar was a little pricey for my taste, but in line with the rest of Rome (10EUR for a mixed drink) Bed was comfortable for me, but the GF found it a little hard. (one of those spaceage sponge type matresses) WELL worth the 560USD we paid for 3 nights over memorial day weekend. My only grip is the internet - Wi-Fi isnt free, and the internet over TV is very slow and limited due to the old version of explorer being used.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in a Noisy City”
Reviews.Author: john71
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in a quiet area of Rome and near a number of good restaurants. Within easy walking distance of the Vatican and the nearest Metro. (Some have posted that it’s a distance from the Metro but we walked it in about 15 minutes). We had a luxury room which was larger than most similar rooms in Rome and, whilst the breakfast was basic with no hot food, it was adequate in the usual continental way. The staff was superb. We were caught up in the ash cloud emergency and they did all they could to accommodate our needs. A definite gem in this large city. There is internet access via the room TV which was a bit clunky but only 5 Euros for a 24 hour period.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Mellini”
Reviews.Author: Washington_DCLucy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Dei Mellini several times. The location is wonderful, as it is not in the thick chaos of the tourist area yet very convenient to all of the sites of interest. There is a wonderful pastisserie just around the corner, Vito's a block away (great for dinner) and there are numerous other fabulous Rome restaurants just a short walk away. The entire set up of Dei Melini is very comfortable and convenient. When you arrive exhausted from an overnight flight, it is such a relief to check in to such a beautiful, welcoming place. While there, we have enjoyed using the lovely sitting areas off of the lobby to meet with family. We were able to get coffee and biscuits served to us there. The breakfasts were wonderful, very good coffee and the hotel has a lovely roof terrace. The staff is professional, speak several languages and is very helpful. My favorite thing about the Mellini is the Jr. Suite because it has a second bathroom! There is a bedroom, the master bathroom, a separate sitting area with a couch that converts to a bed and a "guest" bathroom. This extra bathroom makes all the difference when traveling with kids because it gives you a little more "useful" living area without having to purchase a second room. When comparing it to other hotels, price wise, we feel that this is very reasonable. Overall, we found the Hotel Dei Mellini to be safe, convenient and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, pleasant stay but long walk to the metro.”
Reviews.Author: pduell
Reviews.Content: A sophisticated hotel, with a very modern, business-travel feel. The staff was very professional and we had no problem extending our stay twice. The room was large and clean with a tempurpedic-type mattress on the bed. We had a complimentary continental breakfast (because we had reserved with the hotel directly), and the waitstaff was very friendly and attentive. It is a bit of a walk to the metro station, especially when you are sightseeing all day (since Rome has so much to see), but the bus stops are a little closer. A tip: wireless internet was not available in the rooms, but only downstairs in the lobby, for a fee.
