TV internet was available in the rooms for a small 24-hour charge, but it was difficult to navigate and limiting -- if you need the ability to make reservations, send emails, etc. I don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dei Mellini delivers again!”
Reviews.Author: lyk2ski
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoy this hotel. I had stayed at this hotel some years back and when I found myself back in Italy, I had to stay again. I found the hotel to be just as I remembered. Beautifully clean, bright and elegant. The staff is professional, friendly and a pleasure to converse with. My room was upgraded to a modern double, was well appointed and very comfortable. Maid service was fantastic! Attentive and very friendly! I like the fact this Hotel is on a side street. Just far enough away where you don't hear traffic noise. Location is walking distance to Spanish Steps, Trevi and Forum. Head the other way and you are at the Vatican. It really is an ideal location. Many restaurants in the area as well as convenience stores. I believe this to be an extremely safe area. The only negative about this hotel is their internet options. Truly outrages fees for wireless and only other option is web TV. Need I say more. I hope they change this policy as at present, it is not business man friendly when you have to stay connected. Anyway, well done Dei Mellini... I appreciate you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: larkenRidgefield_CT
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for several nights before flying out of Rome. The hotel was well situated for easy access to public transportation and walking to many of the tourist sights ie. Vatican, Castel San Angelo, Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, Piazza Navonna and more. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated. The hotel was well kept and organized to allow space for small gatherings, a lobby bar, two sitting rooms and a breakfast room. One of the best things about staying here was the friendliness of the hotel desk staff- something that isn't always evident in Rome. Each person went out of their way to give directions, offer suggestions, call to see if their were holiday hours etc. The only drawback was a very basic breakfast but on the whole it was a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dialecti
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel to stay, clean and friendly! EXCELLENT SERVICE! Medium breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ValeMadrid
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel for its location and its bigger than standard rooms. The area, Prati, is more refreshing than the historic center. The service was at times surly, but they had a ot to do. room clean. breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dcreig02
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel in Rome. Was able to pick up the Roma Tour bus right near the hotel. In a quiet location, but central to everything. Reasonably priced and very clean. It was a very comfortable hotel. Would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, good location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: LorrySuffern
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from Italy, spend first 3 days in Rome at the Dei Mellini. Hotel was lovely, we got there several hours before check in but the front desk clerk promised to get us into a room within 30 minutes and he did. Room was surprisingly large with a very nice bathroom and was very comfortable. Location is on the Vatican side of the river, so a little bit out of the way, but my husband and I were still able to walk to wherever we wanted to go and we didnt find it an inconvenience. Definitely get tickets in advance to for the sights you want to see, the lines for the Vatican must have taken half the day to get in and we just skipped the line entirely. well worth it. overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel will be returning”
Reviews.Author: Naboo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Dei mellini for 3 nights in September 2009. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room very clean, housekeeping first class. We travelled to Rome for a 50th birthday celebration and to our surprise and delight on returning to our hotel found a unprompted complimentary bottle of sparkling wine and a birthday card. This was a very wonderful gesture. Location was very convenient for restaurants, shops, and sights without having to be in center. Area was quiet and safe with a fair selection of bars and restaurants within comfortable walking distance. Would return to this hotel should the opportunity present.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been better but it could have been worse...”
Reviews.Author: beatricekogan
Reviews.Content: Had booked a suite. It was spacious but dark and the furniture basic. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were crisp and nice. The wallpaper needed some attention in the bedroom. There was a bottle of sparkling wine and two glasses on arrival although the room was booked for one. The following day a second bottle with two glasses were delivered although the first one had not been touched. It was accompanied by a birthday card from the management. This was not appreciated having left home at that particular date to avoid any celebration or mention of my birthday. The reception staff was not helpful in booking a city tour but handed a leaflet instead not providing any options or information. No information was given about breakfast upon checking in. No thank you or good bye or any greetings were given upon checking out. The breakfast was very basic. The room and the hotel were very clean although the mirror in the lift was in need of a clean. The location was convenient for the Vatican and for the centre. It was rather expensive at £255 a night for one person.

Reviews.Title: “Basic good experience, not crazy about location”
Reviews.Author: rap_mom
Reviews.Content: We just finished a stay at this hotel in mid-August. Be aware that, at this time of the year, Rome shuts down. The hotel is not in a particularly touristy area, so your options for restaurants will be limited and your options for services like groceries, laundry, etc will be virtually nonexistent. In the August heat, it felt like quite a hike to even the closest Metro stop (15-20 minutes), through meandering, empty streets. Of course, many more services may be available at other times of the year. On the other hand, the streets did feel safe, and the front desk did their best to make recommendations regarding open restaurants, even confirming what was/wasn't open. Close to the Vatican but far from major archeological sites. Hotel rooms were nice and reasonably large for Europe. The front desk staff were responsive to our many requests -- no complaints with them at all. Be aware that a half-hour internet connection is 5 Euros, which I find pretty outrageous for a hotel of this class. Breakfast was uneven -- the first day, we had a lovely fresh fruit salad to accompany standard cereals and breads and sweets. Subsequent days, we had to put up with canned fruits. So, a good but not exceptional experience.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and nice”
Reviews.Author: stotorp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel in June 2008. This hotel is pretty far from the Metro station, so it took us awhile to actually arrive and when we did our room was not ready. Three hours after being advised it would be about 45 minutes, our room was still not ready. Needless to say, we were not pleased in the beginning. However, once we got into the room, we were thrilled with the size of the room, which was MUCH larger than we expected. The location was just okay and most of the sites were walkable from the hotel, but it is on the outskirts. After being somewhat less than impressed for a few days, on our last night in the city the concierge scored us a table at an exquisite restaurant on less than 4 hours notice and for that I will always remember this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: patwong03
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Dei Mellini Hotel for a leisure trip in Rome. Pro - Quiet, clean hotel within walking distance (10-15 minutes) of Vatican City and the city center. About 10 minutes walk to the nearest metro station. A few restaurants/wine bars are opened late around the hotel - not much, but a couple. Con - No internet at this hotel, except for paying for it through the TV. I tried it by purchasing the 24 hour package, didn't like it, and the hotel was nice enough to give me a full refund. No other good amenities as well (restaurant, pool, gym). Also charged me about 50 Euros for making six calls to the US. I couldn't use VoIP with my computer, so I didn't have much of a choice. There are worst neighborhoods and hotels in Rome than this one. If you get a good rate (under $200 US dollars) then you should consider this hotel. Otherwise, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, relaxed and well-located”
Reviews.Author: Magistrand
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully refurbished old builidng which is comfortable, elegant and spacious. It is tastefully furnished throughout. Our bargain room was huge, with a spacious bathroom and entry hall as well. The staff were extremely helpful at all times. We only had the continental buffet breakfast, which included fresh fruit and wonderful Italian yogurt. Other guests requested cooked breakfasts - which looked handsome enough. The location is excellent - close enough to the Vatican, but closer still to the main shopping areas, Spanish steps and Trevi. We walked everywhere, including the day we explored the Colosseum and Roman ruins.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very nice, room just ok”
Reviews.Author: faf1960
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews on trip advisor. However, personally I was a little disappointed in the room as well as the "full breakfast" - below that calibre of a continental breakfast. The staff could not have been nicer....very helpful/accomodating/etc.....nonetheless, would not recommend. My son and I swear we got bug bites at night. Go to the Michael Angelo Hotel by the vatican instead (we stayed there on our way home).

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Stravelor
Reviews.Content: Location removed from the center of Rome for a quieter experience across the river and near the Vatican. Bus, subway and walking access easy. Local neighborhood close to nice shopping and meals. Rooms small and basic. Internet available for a fee. Breakfast nice. Tap water tastes good. Concierge capabilities varied based on the person helping. Room air conditioning not very effective. Hotel was good but there are probably better places for less.

Reviews.Title: “tutto bene”
Reviews.Author: zogia
Reviews.Content: big rooms with clean sheets and bathroom. near the vatican city and the other sightseeings of rome. the staff very friendly. the only negative that there was no lunch surved to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located and big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ThomasHa
Reviews.Content: The rooms were huge within european standards, they were clean. Service was at times a bit "italian" (not very attentive and quick) but overall it was a good choice, the price was good and the location worked best for us - no noise but still close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent - would recommend whole heartedly.”
Reviews.Author: tjwb
Reviews.Content: We literally just got back from a long weekend in Rome staying at Dei Mellini and I wanted to confirm the excellent reviews we read here before booking the hotel. We had a deluxe room with a king size bed for the stay which was hard to fault. Room was large and completely silent, the bed comfortable and the bathroom excellent. The staff were without fail charming and extremely helpful - Alessandro on the front desk went out of his way to make our stay better and was a mine of useful and accurate information. He also recommended a number of wonderful restaurants and we had complete faith in his advice. All in all, if you are considering a trip to Rome then don’t hesitate - it’s a truly wonderful city. And whilst you are there, you could do a lot worse than stay in an excellent hotel which is in walking distance of everything you will want to go and see...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend break hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattnalex
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Dei mellini in 2009. All in all this was a clean hotel, in what we consider a good location. It is not completely in the heart of the city, rather about 15 minutes walk from most attractions. We made it to the vatican in about 15 minutes. The hotel is well maintained and the breakfast was what you would expect - cereal, croissants, fruit juice, cheese and ham etc. Rome itself is a beautiful city with some fantastic sights to see. the restaurants were lovely and i am very pleased i went. I would however pre warn that the amount of beggers, confidence tricksters, and general people trying to extort money from you for just about everything prom roses to photo's is incredibley high, and incredibly annoying. I have travelled to many cities and have never know it this bad. Perhaps we were just unlucky. Matt

Reviews.Title: “Sweet”
Reviews.Author: Patman9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at this hotel during Holy Week in April. The staff is friendy, helpful, and speak English. I am not the kind of person that gets upset about people not speaking English, however being fluent in Spanish I can usually use either of the two to communicate. Italian is another story, so it was real helpful. This is a very nice hotel, clean luxurious room, in a quiet safe neighborhood of mixed commercial, hotel, cafe, and apartment houses. Close to the river, and close to the bridges that cross over to the tourist areas. While this hotel is not located right in the middle of the tourist areas, the benefit is that it is very quiet and peaceful. The walk to the Vatican is about the same distance as the walk to the sights. It seemed a bit of a hike late at night, but we never felt unsafe or like it was overwhelmingly far to get back. We did take a bus to the colliseum and Roman forum area but it was easy to catch at the corner. The hotel staff were real helpful in guiding us. I would recommend this place for someone that is willing to be slightly off center stage in exchange for a little more peace and quiet. The price was also a little better for what you get than those near the monuments. Oh, the beds are of the very firm posterpedic foam type, which we liked but may be a matter of taste. I would definately go back to Hotel Mellini, it's a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Tess01
Reviews.Content: My sister and I really enjoyed this hotel. When we arrived the staff made us feel welcome and throughout our three nights there they were very helpful in their attitude and advice. The rooms, while not huge, were certainly spacious enough and the bathrooms very good. The rooms were quiet and the breakfast was good also. The only slight negatives were that the rooms were too warm and the airconditioning was not turned on (however, having said that, it was unseasonably warm in Rome for March for the days we were there) and the mattresses were quite hard. This seems common in lots of hotels who seem to equate a supportive mattress with a hard mattress. But neither of these small niggles overshadowed our stay and the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff more than made up for these. The hotel is within walking distance of anywhere in Rome. It is on the same side of the river as the Vatican which is about 10-15 minutes walk away. The Piazza del Popolo and Piazza Navonna are also both about 10-15 minutes walk back across the river. We bought a "hop-on, hop-off" bus ticket for two days but only used it for an hour on the first day. After that we just walked everywhere - so my advice is not to bother if you are able and fit enough to walk for the duration. Just do a bit of tourist research before your trip. Going on maps.google and planning some walking "routes" beforehand, and using the hotel maps provided meant that everything was easy to get to by foot. Oh, to save yourself time on a tight schedule, visit some churches early in the morning (7-7.30am) - check opening times beforehand. This meant that we had more time to queue for the other things like the Vatican!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to revisit soon”
Reviews.Author: paalSussex
Reviews.Content: Double Delux Room on 4th floor,very good size.Excellent location with friendly staff,lovely continental breakfast,however water suppplied to make tea never very hot! visited most places on foot, once we found our bearings it was fairly easy to find your way around using a map.Have already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: DanEavesFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a friend and my son. The room was huge (even with an additional bed in) and standards of cleanliness were excellent. Hotel is a bit more out of the way for sights but Rome is easily accessible on the underground. EATING OUT - Recommend Navona Notte restaurant just round the back of the Piaza Navona for dinner(turn your back on the fountain and take road in front - Via di Tor Millina, then second left Via del Teatro Pace). Fab pasta and pizza - must be good as all the local police seem to be in there ordering their takeaway!(Via del Teatro Pace)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nawset
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dei Mellini in July 2008 for three nights. Although it was a challenge to find the hotel at first (lots of walking the side streets from the metro) we loved the location. It was right in the middle of Rome (halfway between the major sites (Spanish Stairs and the like) and the Vatican. Everything was in walking distance. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff were very friendly. The rooms were small but to be expected in Europe. The price was very reasonable. I would totally stay here again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: princessme123
Reviews.Content: After shopping around for ages, this hotel was the best for the money. Rome is very expensive and most rooms are tiny. the rooms here are lovely and big and the service was great! The breakfast was good by europe standards, nothing except tea and coffee is hot. Price was still high but so is everywhere in Rome, but good value. In Rome make sure you NEVER eat or drink near any of the attractions, not even an ice-cream. just walk a few streets away and everything is a quarter of the price. (Nearly everywhere is walking distance in Rome). And if you do buy something, then dont sit down; I bought 1 scoup of icecream (near St Peters) and sat down while he was getting it and it cost me 10 euros, and he still expected a tip! Plus it wasn't very good! Buy a guide and look for the locals taverns in residential districts for much better quality food at cheaper prices!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Fabiolla
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, good breakfast and also kind staff. Locations is perfect, rates slightly to high, but that's Rome. Would certainly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, value-laden hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brandywine57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at Dei Mellini at the end of our two week vacation to Italy. It was superbly located for an easy walk to the Piazza Navonne, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, the Vatican, and Sistine Chapel. We were very pleased with the staff, who were friendly, helpful, and spoke conversational English. The room and bath were lovely, and the continental breakfast much more than you would expect. For the price of this four star hotel situated one block from the Tiber River, we could not imagine finding a place more well appointed or well located for this part of Rome. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jbrett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel which has a good location. The rooms are nice, clean, spacious with a nice bathroom. The hotel is a short walk to the Vatican City but further away from the main town to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain but easily walkable. The hotel is tucked away a bit and we had to help diect the taxi driver there. The bar in the hotel is fairly expensive and you are better off trying the less tourist places in town. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel but I think the hotel maybe more in the town would be better but then probably be more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uckfield
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Above average accommodation. We had a room on the 6th floor with small balcony and plenty of space. The staff are excellent, very helpful and speak very good English. Location is out of the city centre so very quiet, byt takes approx 15 minutes walk to the Vatican one way, and about the same to the Old Town and Spanish Steps the other The hotel can organise a car to collect or return to the airport (c45 Euros) and this is worth doing. We pre booked a Terravision bus from Ciampino. Their website said 'Fast and Frequent' and; 'Timed to coincide with arrivals'.... yeah right... We stood around in the full sun for over an hour and had to wait for the second bus to arrive because of the queue. The journey into Rome put us off using this service and we booked a car from the hotel back to the airport. Much more relaxing as long as you ignore the driver cutting everyone else up! Overall a great place for a city break, would recommend this hotel, but avoid the Terriblevision buse service

Reviews.Title: “good overall”
Reviews.Author: leilui
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rather expensive but very good. We were generally happy about it, though nothing really stands out. Maybe the location: Away from the maddening crowds but but still very central, with a bit of a glimpse into Roman life.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, quiet for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine170
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hidden away near the river in a quiet location. We walked everywhere during out stay in Rome and although the main attractions are not on the hotel doorstep, they are close enough to walk to. The hotel is small and clean and the reception staff are there if you need them but mostly just leave you to get on with it. They all speak perfect English. Our room was spacious and clean with a good en-suite. The breakfast was very continental and not that great! Overall I would recommend it for a city break as it ticks all of the boxes and is a good base for exploring. It is a very good price for 4 star in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a 5" hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeniseSurrey
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. We had a superior room, which even with a cot in still felt huge. The hotel is not located in the heart of town but no more than 10-15 minute walk over the River Taba. Breakfast is as you would expect in a continental hotel. I would most definitely stay at this hotel for my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mrmoulder
Reviews.Content: I booked this 4 star hotel via BA.com which to my surprise was considerably cheaper than expaedia and other such sites. The hotels staff were extremely friendly and always willing to assist with obtaining taxis, restaurant tables advice on travel within Rome etc. The hotel rooms were well furnished and immaculately kept. The hotels breakfast was continental and adequate. The hotel itself is situated 150 yards from the Ponte Cavour bridge which itself is 100 yards from main shopping street in Rome Via Del Corsa. Other attractions wihin easy walking distance include the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheonand Piazza Navonna. I would suggest a taxi is the best and quickest method of reaching the Vatican and the Colloseum costs 8 euros approx. Certain parts of Rome are seady and graffiti is prevalent as is litter. The Dei Mellini is in a business area and a major police station is in the same street perhaps that was the reason why the area was quiet and no graffiti was evident. There are a number of good restaurants close to the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel if I returned to Rome again. But be warned the traffic in central Rome is horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice gesture”
Reviews.Author: OscarWestSussex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Rome for my 65th Birthday and stayed at the 'Dei Mellini'. The place was exactly as their brochure had described and we found the Reception staff to be more than helpful. We walked everywhere in the City and found the location to be fine , close to the Vatican but further to the Colessium. We found the distances to the various Historical sites generally nearer than anticipated. In the evening the area was quiet and safe (almost next door to the 'Cabinieri' station) which was most welcome after a hectic day's sightseeing. The Hotel management surprised us with a bottle of 'sparkly' for my birthday which we thought was a nice gesture. The breakast was more than adequate, cold meats, cereals, cheese, fruits, jams and fresh fruit juice with a choice of teas and coffee. We would definitely consider staying at the Mellini again and would reccomend a great little Ristorante called the 'Sor' Eva', Piazza della Rovere on the banks of the Tiber (the same side as the Hotel and two bridges down from the Castel S. Angelo.) Every night it was full of Romans; a sure sign of quality and sensible pricing!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: EWKSeattle
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini is a clean, crisp, modern hotel. While it's not strong on charm or local flavor, we were very pleased with the size and comfort of our rooms. (We had adjoining rooms that essentially created a 2 bedroom suite that we shared with our children.) We found the hotel surprisingly quiet, and well located. It's a short stroll across the river to the heart of the city, and a pleasant walk to the Vatican areas as well. The staff were pleasant, and the breakfast buffet was varied and generous.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: hjlj940
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for the Italy v Scotland rugby match - March 2008. Hotel was central for stadium and was clean. Room was very nice, quiet. Bar was fun. Would certainly recommend. Breakfast not brill but fine. Service good.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise !”
Reviews.Author: BruceCalgary_Alberta
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini Hotel was a pleasant surprise, right from the start of our 3 day stay here the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel rooms were clean and overall the hotel was well run. It is just a short 2 minute walk to the Tiber River and within easy distance to all of the major sites and shopping. What we really enjoyed were some of the local restaurants within 5 - 10 minutes walking. These are not tourist places, and therefore the food and ambience are completely different. Prices are lower too !! It helps to at least attempt a few words in Italian and makes the experience special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel / Location”
Reviews.Author: DirkCheshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Dei Mellini for a few days a nice Hotel in quiet area, the location is good for the City centre and Vatican, but a long walk to the Forum / Colosseum. IWe (4 adults with luggage) arrived at Fiumincino Airport and took a taxi from outside the terminal directly to the Hotel, its very easy and quick,. The cost of a taxi is a set price of 40 Euro, which compares very well with the train into Roma Termini (11 euro each) and then the number 70 bus or taxi. If taking taxi back to airport allow plenty of time as roads can be very busy

Reviews.Title: “Not certain what some people expect in Europe”
Reviews.Author: MetroNYNJ
Reviews.Content: In reading some reviews of the Dei Mellini, I'm not certain what people expect of hotels in Europe, in general, and Italy, in particular. My husband and I spent several days at the Dei Mellini as part of a few weeks in Italy in February/March, and couldn't have been happier. Our room, which was relatively inexpensive by Rome standards to start with, wasn't ready when we arrived early one morning, so we were upgraded to a junior suite, at the hotel's suggestion. The front desk couldn't have been more helpful making reservations, and making suggestions about restaurants similar to where we had already been or parts of Rome we had never seen. I saw them help others in a similar way in three different languages. Breakfast was a European breakfast -- in fact, closer to a German hotel, and pretty substantial by Italian standards. It was far more than you eat in other parts of Italy, like Tuscany or the Veneto, where an espresso and a brioche are typical. One reviewer complained that everything was a 15 minute walk from the hotel -- we thought it a fantastic location that you could get to the Vatican, Piazza del Popolo, Piazza Navonna, etc. with just a 15 minute walk. It's Italy. You walk everywhere!!!! All in all, we took a chance with this hotel at an Italian friend's recommendation, and couldn't have been happier. People really need to remember that to experience another country, you need to immerse yourself in their customs. You can do that in comfort and style at a hotel like this at a pretty reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dei Mellini”
Reviews.Author: zmatca3
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Dei Mellini for 5 nights during the last week of July 2007. We booked this hotel based on book reviews and from info on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel staff was very knowledgable and with the exception of one front desk staff member, always willing to help with directions and advice on all aspects of our visit. The rooms were a little smaller than I expected from a hotel with this rating. The staff at the breakfast buffet always greeted us with a smile and made sure our day always got off to a great start! Great location between ancient Rome and the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Average hotel and room”
Reviews.Author: Voyageurfou
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel but nothing special. Room deco is far from what the hotel shows on its website. Staff is OK but again nothing special. Breakfast is OK. The location is great, 15 mn walk from the Spanish Steps, 15 mn walk from the Vatican and 15 mn walk from Plaza Navonna. I got a very good deal for this 4 night stay but I would not book this hotel again for more than 130/150 euro for a double, which is below what the hotel charges most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Clean, Modern”
Reviews.Author: kktraveler
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading several tour books and reading trip advisor reviews. It was not suggested by my travel agent but it was my first trip to Europe and honestly wanted a hotel that was a bit larger/more modern than the typical italian hotels. It was booked for part of my stay so we spent only 3 nights here. My other hotel was right near the Pantheon so more centrally located and this provided a wonderful balance. The rooms were superb; I booked one double room and one single. They were large, spotless, and modern with beautful spacious bathrooms. The double room was very large with a huge walk in closet. The breakfast included was typical in a lovely breakfast room with a modern contemporary flare. There is a lovely rooftop terrace which we looked at but did not have time to enjoy with chaises and tables and chairs. I found the staff to be most helpful. I traveled with my daughter and her friend who was studying abroad and met us in Rome. One night before dinner we decided to go to the newly released movie The DaVinci Code which was showing in english near Termine station but it was unclear what actual language it was showing in. I tried to call the theatre myself but speak no italian. The desk staff happily called for me and got the info i needed, called cabs whenever we needed them and arranged for me to have a private car to the airport when i left at 5AM (same $ as cab)I could not have been happier with the staff. I agree that its location is not a central as some others however it is right across the Bridge of Angels, very close to the Vatican and Castle S'Antangelo and i walked to the Pantheon area and Piazza Navona very easily. It is in walking distance of L'orso 80 and to me it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle but still close enough to walk many great sights. I also agree that there is very little in the way of quick dining/coffee in the immediate vicinity but this did not detract from my opinion/rating. I would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very good”
Reviews.Author: gerry1000
Reviews.Content: I took my dad to Rome for his 80th Birthday. We were recommended this hotel by British Airways holidays. The staff on arrival at reception were excellent. A bottle of champagne and a basket of fruit greeted us on arrival to the room. We were staying for 3 nights and we booked a twin room. The room was a perfect size for both of us. The beds were changed every day, and in the evening the beds were turned down. Room was spotless. This was my first time in Rome, so did not know what to expect. Hotel staff are very efficent and were on hand to provide is with the best way to get around (without getting ripped off). Breakfast was a continental breakfast and was very good. Only one slight down side for me was there was no restaurant in the evening, so we has to go out for dinner which was no big issue. Pleany of very good restaurants within 10 minutes walking distance. Would vist the hotel again. Hope this helps..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to Visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: rpbf
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to visit Rome. Near from the Vaticam and S'Angelo. The hotel is situated in a calm quarter, with good restaurants a 100 meters of police and a 300 meters of city tour bus([---]), fantastic to see the city. Nice Staff and clean and good rooms. The hotel it's a 20 minutes, walking, from the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Cordial Staff, Satisfactory Rooms, Location somewhat lacking”
Reviews.Author: Silbermanlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days at this hotel a short walking distance from the Vatican -- which was good -- and close to the River -- which was great. But far away from everything else we wanted to see. We still walked everywhere, but most people wouldn't be willing to walk the 45-60 minutes required to get to the Colleseum or some of the other attractions. Roman streets tend to bend in odd ways, and tourist maps are notoriously bad, so proximity to the river was a plus. Roman nightlife is active, which makes it more important to be close to the action -- Fountain Trevi or the ancient Roman sites. The room was fine and staff were friendly, though their English was sometimes spotty. They didn't go out of their way to be helpful or to point out sites to see. Most importantly to me, they didn't respond to e-mails before I arrived as to the airport pick-up options and reservations at the Vatican museums (not available, in case you're wondering...) Basically, we will stay somewhere else when we return to Rome, primarily because the location was not convenient to the outside museum features of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “All right but nothing special, do not trust website photos”
Reviews.Author: ValLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel at Christmas for two nights. Got a deal on a deluxe double room. From the photos on the web it looked like a palace. We found the hotel and the rooms okay, new, clean, but the wow factor was missing. The decoration was a little tired, and there was no luxurious feel at all. The rooms at the front don't get much sun - but I suppose it is much worse at the back. Maybe on the higher floors? (we were on the 3rd level). The staff's recommandations for food were horrible. We spent Christmas Eve in an overpriced Tuscan trattoria at the other end of town, just wrong for a special occasion in Rome. They did not seem to know of the lovely and delicious Chinese restaurant just around the corner from the hotel. What we liked: the breakfast buffet was good, bathrobes and toiletries were top of the range, and they surprised us with an enormous chocolate christmas tree - which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “More 'American' than most Roman Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Nassau_St
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3-4 days in early June 2006. Of all the hotels in which we stayed on our Italian holiday, we found this one most like an American 'upscale' hotel. Is that good or bad? I guess that is an individual question...but the Dei Mellini definitely felt 'American'. This is a 3.5 star hotel in NYC or Chicago. It was clean and comfortable....almost luxurious. The staff were helpful. We had no complaints...although there was nothing that made us say "WOW"...we must come back. The location was convenient to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: DLang#1
Reviews.Content: Very nice and extremely clean hotel room. Location very short walk to the Vatican, 20 minute walk to Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain and popular restaurants. You can take a train and metro from Rome airport at inexpensive cost, but the hotel is not easy to find from the nearby metro station. Complimentary breakfast is not great. Some hotel staff were very nice and helpful, and some were indifferent. Not many restaurants nearby. On the whole, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Dei Mellini”
Reviews.Author: DianaA
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. Upon check in we were given a Junior Suite (I think). The room was spaccious and comfortable as well as clean. We found all the staff we dealt with to be most proffesional helpful and pleasant. The location was perfect for us , not more than 15 minutes comfortable walk to everywhere. Our visit to Rome was wonderful and the Dei Mellini certainly contributed to this positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the attitude of Front Desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: LeeWolfy
Reviews.Content: Firstly, hotel is acceptable, although in no way worthy of a 4 Star rating - no services or amenities, and breakfast buffet consists of cold meats, yoghurt and tinned fruit! As we attempted to check-in we were told by Reservation Manager Alan F that previous guests had apparently 'refused to check out' and as such there was no room available for us. We were then effectively bundled into a cab and sent to the supposed sister hotel Dei Borgognoni, were we were given a tiny dark rook stinking of stale cigarette smoke. We refused this, and after much argument we insisted to be allowed to stay in the hotel we had originally booked. Surprisingly, a room became available! This seeming dishonesty from the Dei Mellini management cast a shadow over our stay in Rome. We had similarly poor service from the hotel bar - and a Night Manager Davide Q. In short - travel to Rome (fabulous city) but avoid the Dei Mellini.

Reviews.Title: “save your money”
Reviews.Author: kazmodo
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice, Florence and Rome on our recent trip to Italy, and this was the worst hotel of the three. The air conditioning did not work great, breakfast had nothing warm, not even a toaster, our room wasn't ready til 3pm, the shower pressure was awful, and there were no extra pillows. A lot of you might think, "you could have just asked for other things", or "sounds typical for a european hotel room", but our Florence and Venice hotel all were GREAT in the above categories. We also had 2 wet bar charges that were incorrect (we didn't use anything), and their computer system couldn't fix it, so they had to manually calculate the charges and are mailing us the receipt. All of the the Rome attractions are within walking distance, but overall we didn't like the location -- it was too quiet and residental, which may appeal to some people. I honestly don't understand how this hotel gets a luxury rating....well, people were always asking us if they could call us a car, maybe that's luxurious to some. Would definetely NOT choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for an Upscale Stay at a fair Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: cascnich
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a 17 day trip in Europe. We booked the Mellini for our party of 14. As a family we traveled to Rome for three nights and then took a 12 day cruise to various ports in the Med. I spent much time researching hotels for this trip and wanted an upscale stay at a resoanble price point. For many of my family it was their first trip to Europe so I wanted to insure a comfortable stay. The Mellini did not disapoint any of us! In fact we liked it so much we cancelled our hotel near the airport for our last night in Rome and retuned to stay at the Mellini. The hotel itself is just as the hotel's website pictures portray it! The lobby is sone in various kinds of Italian Marble and offers a small bar area on one side and a sitting area on the other. The breakfast room is located off the front desk and open s into the courtyard should you wish to dine outside. Each morning the included breakfast conasited of fresh rolls, croissants, great sugar donuts, hams, chesses and fruit. Various juices and sparkling water were served as well as coffe, tea and capuccinos at no charge. The rooms themselves were spacious compared to European standards. We had six rooms in total so I feel we were able to get a relatvely good feel of the different layouts. Each room had a marble entrance way where a double doored closet held a suffucient amount of clothes. There was a programable safe in the closet too. A mini bar area wa also in the entrance way. The bathrooms were done in white marble with a marble countertop. Though the bath tub was narrow the shower inside was fine. Each bathroom also had a bidet. The sleeping area was rather spacious offering the bed, a desk with desk chair and an arm chair near the window. The only issue was the effeciency of the air conditioning. Some of our rooms had better cooling than others. As for location it is within walking distance of all the sites. Keep in mind the heat is rather hot in July but we still were able to walk to all sites except the Collosseum which was only a 6-7 Euro cab ride. Take Ponte Cavour across the river and walk about four blocks. It will take you to the hear of the Via Condotti and Piazza di Spangna! The staff was very helpful in mapping out sites and locations as well as calling cabs. Overall the Mellini was an excellent choice located in a quite neigborhoon just off the Tiber. If you want o remove yourself from the hussle and bussle yet be only a few blocks from it choose the Mellini. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KINGOFOMAHA
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to some very nice Italian restaurants. Service was better than average and the rooms were clean and comfortable.This is a 4 Star Hotel as advertised and worth the price paid. We enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: Phantasialandfan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Rome and chose the Dei Mellini via Expedia and Tripadvisor. It is a lovely modern hotel in a quiet street within walking distance of everywhere - although taxis are extremely cheap too. It is on the Vatican side of the Tiber and located near the Ponte Cavour bridge. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The reception staff are particularly informative. The breakfasts are only continental but with a wide choice. The rooms are quite spacious and very clean. The 6th floor front rooms have little balconies but I would actually recommend an inner room with just a tiny courtyard view - quieter and cooler I think. The roof terrace is spacious but could do with a bar! It is worth asking the reception to organise your transfer back to the airport - it saved us 25 euro! I recommend the Piazza Navona for evenings - numerous restaurents, pretty fountains and quaint street entertainment late into the evening. The metro is cheap but hot and does not really run to the places you want to be. I recommend the red open top tour bus 110 which is 13 euro for a day ticket and you can hop on and off. There were four of us - I would describe as middle-aged and we quite happily wandered the cobbled streets late into the evening with no fears whatsoever. I could not understand other reviews regarding worries or concerns in that respect. It was a superb weekend with beautiful weather, we saw all the major sights and the whole experience was made all the more pleasant by the haven of the dei mellini and the courteous helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our trip to Italy.”
Reviews.Author: PishPosh
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of it's high ranking here on TripAdvisor and was not dissapointed at all. They had almost all the proper amenities of a 4 star hotel, bath robes and kettles being the biggest omission. We arrived at around 7 in the morning and was given a temp room as their check in time was only at 2pm. The quick check in is very much appreciated although the room needed some repair. The desk lamp wasn't working (with the shattered bulb still in the socket) and the toilet really needs to be cleaned properly. The whole room only had one bedside lamp for lighting , which meant the room was impossibly dark. We got our proper room the next day and boy was the difference in quality HUGE. It is nice, clean and quite spacious. Everything worked properly in this room. The location is great, very quiet and safe. On the same street there is a Carabineri (sp?) station and there's a nice grocer shop run by a nice elderly couple. This made it easy for us to get supplies for our day trips. The Vatican is a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. The staff were friendly and when asked for suggestions for restaurants, pointed us to some really good places. Unfortunately for us, one of their staff members failed to notify us of a taxi strike the next day we were due to leave when asked if we should make a taxi booking. Having only found out too late on the day of checkout we had to rush with luggage in hand by foot to the nearest Metro station to catch our train. That's the only issue I had with them, which in all honesty could have been avoided. However the staff in the morning did try to get us a driver but to no avail. The breakfast is good for an Italian hotel. They have a full range of Twinnings teas that you can select, and have cereal, bread and some meat slices. Not much when compared to a typical English breakfast, but by Italian standards, this is quite good. Overall, I'd definately stay here again for our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service at a superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Dei Mellini through my travel agent; I am so glad I did! The staff at the hotel was excellent. Their service was by far the best I received during my 16-day stay in Italy! The location is excellent; all points of my interest were within walking distance-with the exception of the Colliseum. However, travelling there by city bus was easy and inexpensive. The breakfast served was outstanding, and the quality of service was fabulous. The hotel is situated near the Tibor River, along which I ran each morning. I always felt safe and "at home" at the Hotel Dei Melilini. A local resaturant ~700 Cafe ~ is great and inexpensive. A local market (on the same street as the hotel) offers fruit, vegetables, water, and beverages at a great value. In addition, the gelateria on the corner of Via Cavour and the river served the BEST GELATTO IN ITALY! I will definitely stay at the Hotel Dei Mellini again. I will recommend it to EVERYONE! I would especially like to thank HORACIO (front desk) for his kindness and expert service. He not only made our stay in Rome more enjoyable, he also saved us in Florence! Horacio hleped us to secure an alternate hotel (to the one I had originally booked). His help allowed us to appreciate Florence--after a horrible first night there! I will be forever grateful to him. My only regret is that we didn't stay at the Hotel Dei Mellini long enough! Most sincerely, Elizabeth Pismo Beach, California, U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Could be fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: FrequentlyLost
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini is off the beaten path, in a quiet residential neighorhood a block off the river - excellent if you have no 'walk or wobble home' evening plans. It is truly located between the Vatican and Colosseum, but be advised, the location is as good as it gets for walking but it's still a fair hike to each major attraction. There are several small grocery stores in the neighborhood for bottled water and snacks. We had dinner at several neighborhood restaraunts with mixed results - the Clock was the best, but in the end we wished we had taken a taxi to Via Vanetto for at least one evenining out. We drove to Rome as first timers and were it not for a borrowed GPS gizmo, we'd still be searching for the hotel - but my poor sense of direction is not Rome's fault and we appreciated the 10 euro/night valet parking - best price we experienced in Florence, Venice, Rome or Sicily. The hotel was very nice - about what you'd expect from a 4 star - with a few minor dissapointments. The lobby is large, comfortable and elegant (lots of marble) with 'round the clock internet access. The bar is pleasant - small and open to the lobby with a healthy selection and healthier prices. Breakfast (included) was good but not spectacular. Good fresh fruit, quality breads, cerials, cold meats and yoghurts - no hot servings. The room was beautifull, very large and elegantly appointed in English style. We stayed in a 'double deluxe' room at about 275 euro/night and at first blush, it was really impressive - large entry way, closets, fabulous and comfortable bed, desk and arm chairs as comfortable as some hotel beds I've endured. Nothing in the way of a view, but I think all the rooms at this hotel suffer the same limitation. The bath was large and very well appointed, (now for the minor dissapointments) but there were small mold deposits in the corner tiles of the tub (not OK anywhere - particularly in a 4 star hotel) that prevented my wife from taking a well desrved soak. The toilet and facial tissue was airport quality, if that - again, not something I would expect at this price. The bath condition certainly didn't ruin our stay at this nice hotel, but it was a dissapointment. There's an attractive sun deck on the top floor that we enjoyed the first night, but it was closed for the remainder of our stay no announcement or explanation - another dissapointment / irritation. On our last night in Rome, we attempted to rent a movie and found our video system malfunctioning - no problem with removing the charge from our bill, but another irritation nonetheless. Desk service was efficient and polite - even warm depending upon who was helping us and I have no complaints there. The breakfast servers were very nice and pleasant. Would we stay there again? Probably not at these prices - the small things that prevent the Dei Mellini from being a fabulous hotel are important to me. Next time we'll select a place closer to a main attraction and taxi to the far off corners (trust me when I say I'll not be driving in Rome again).

Reviews.Title: “Good Prati Location”
Reviews.Author: desertguy
Reviews.Content: This is an average 4 star hotel. The room was clean and the hotel staff were friendly. The room was on the smaller side and had a view of the street and was listed as a superior room. The a/c did not work well but kept the room somewhat cool. Breakfast was included and it included the standard fare. The hotel location was really good for shopping on via cola di renzo and good for eating in local places in Prati. It was also within walking distance of the Vatican, Spanish Steps and many other tourist locations. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: NIce, small hotel. The location is ok. You can walk to the Vatican (which is good because there is no parking there), but have to drive everywhere else. They have valet parking and a garage close by, which is wonderful since there is no place to park. The room was nice with a balcony (view of the street). The staff was friendly. I enjoyed staying here, but if I'm going to spend that much money again I would probably look for a larger hotel with more amenities or something closer to the tourist places like Trevi Fountain, etc... No night life there, but a police station was close by and felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Facelift, Overpriced, Near the Vatican, Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: butterfly00
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini was a disappointment. We spent out first two days in Rome at the Sofitel and then stayed at the Dei Mellini for two separate 2-day stays (4 days total). Although it cost almost exactly the same amount (roughly $400/night in May 2006), it was night and day from the Sofitel. First, the entire hotel is run-down. The carpet is worn, the hallways smell bad, the upholstery on the seating downstairs is falling apart and generally the hotel is not being cared for properly. Even more importantly, the air conditioning is very weak and even if you put it on the lowest temperature possible, it doesn't cool the room very much. The rooms don't have enough lighting. When you walk through the door of the hotel, you are immediately confronted with 6 or 7 stairs - kind of an unpleasant surprise when you have just arrived with all of your luggage! During our first stay, they gave us a room with an open sleeper sofa as one of the "beds" - the sofa was broken, which we didn't realize until the next day after waking up with severe back pain. When we complained the next day, they gave us a rollaway, but the entire experience was quite unpleasant. (We called the front desk, they promised to call us back, and never did - while we stayed up later than we wanted to waiting for them to call and finally gave up and went to bed on a mattress on the floor.) To their credit, when we complained at checkout the next day, they did upgrade us to a larger suite for our second stay - but it didn't make up for 2 days of back pain during an expensive trip. The location was less than ideal - it's across the river, by the Vatican, but you have to cross the river and do some walking to get to any of the other tourist sites. Since Rome is a fairly large city, we did do some considerable walking to visit all the usual sites (Collosseum, Pantheon, Museo Borghese, etc.) The breakfast buffet is somewhat limited in selection, but the items were pretty good. (The bread was hard as a rock, but that was pretty typical of everywhere we ate in Italy.) On the positive side, their suites are huge -- they literally have two bathrooms! And the staff is courteous. They let us leave luggage with them during the time between our two stays. Bottom line for us, though, is that this hotel is not nice enough for 400 dollars per night (that's what we paid in May 2006), and we'll stay at the Sofitel for our entire stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “Good Digs Staff Could Be More Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel in that it is in a quiet street and reasonable walking distance to major attractions. It is well finished with tasteful furnishings. The hotel was clean and well maintained. The breakfast staff were friendly, however the front desk and bar staff were average to outright disinterested in guests. The hotel is a good option if you are self sufficient and do not seek to be pampered by the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Dei Mellini for 5 nights over Easter 2006 with my husband and 12 year old daughter. We had a brilliant time. Our suite was spacious and comfortable, with good facilities. It was in a quiet location. The real bonus was that we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go from here. A little ambitious for some maybe but Rome is such a wonderful place to wander. 15 minutes on foot to the Spanish Steps, if you can avoid window shopping on the way. 20 minutes to the Vatican. Good restaurants in the immediate area (ask the hotel to book) or a pleasant stroll back from dinner across the river. We were delighted with our choice. The reviews certainly helped us to make our decision.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: pjglasgow
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini was an extremely well run hotel. Clean, efficient and close to The Vatican and also the centre of Rome. It is a great base to take a walking tour with Angel Tours Rome who were a fantastic group of Irish and English guides who knew all about art, history and architecture in the Vatican Museum. Avoid the earphone posse and well meaning punters who will promise to enlighten to you, but go for the Celts who give an honest account of the art, politics and religious history.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great trip in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BazHokie
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini lives up to its 4-star rating completely. The rooms were huge and spacious (compared to most Italian hotel rooms). The rooms and bathrooms were well appointed. The staff was friendly and helpful when asked (they gave us a wonderful paper map of Rome that we used extensively for our entire trip). The morning breakfast/brunch included croissants, italian ham, 2 kinds of cheeses, fruit, cereal, etc. Hotel was very clean as well. There were a few mechanical problems however. One night, the hotel lost power...and it took several hours for the power to be restored. It wasn't the hotel's fault, however, and I think it was an isolated incident. The hotel staff apologized for the inconvenience. Also, one day, the server was down for internet access...but these were all minor inconveniences. The location is fairly close to the Vatican. The surrounding streets are more quiet compared to the rest of Rome. The hotel isn't exactly in the center of all the "hustle and bustle" of Rome, but it is only a 15 minute walk away from all the major sites. We kind of preferred it this way. We could spend the whole day walking through the center of Rome...but then retire back to our own oasis, away from the crowds, late at night. There is also a Carabineri (police) office just down the road...so you'll feel quite safe staying there. All in all...a great hotel to stay at...and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amathus
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. It was clean and the staff were polite and happy and helpful in our requests for ordering taxis etc. We were given a map of Rome on arrival and they marked the hotel, the bus to take to certain sites as well as highlighting the sites we requested. We found this very helpful. Breakfast was continental and there was a great selection but you could order eggs and bacon if you wanted for a small extra cost. The room we had was small but adequate for our needs during our weekend break. It was within walking distance of the major sites. I would stay again if I returned to Rome and reccommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Dei Mellini Hotel - Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Buffalos13
Reviews.Content: The Mellini is in a great local neighborhood - you can walk to the Vatican and Spanish steps in about 15 minutes. There are a couple of nice local restaurants like Vito's Wine Bar close by. And the rooms are very nice and fairly priced. This is a great find in Europe/Rome! We would stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in the Eternal City!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini is everything we could have expected in a European hotel! Yes, the room is a bit small, but it was clean and comfortable. My wife and I loved the breakfast, too. Great selection of pastries, fruit, yogurt, juices, etc. The service was outstanding on all levels. Bring comfortable shoes, because everything is within walking distance, except the Colosseum and St. John's in Lateran. I think those were our only 2 cab rides. My only other suggestion is not to change cash anywhere in the area - the rates are bad. We found decent exchange rates at a bank on Cola di Rienzo. As we checked out, I told the front desk that we were quite happy, and would be giving positive feedback on tripadvisor. The two employees at the desk smiled (yes, everyone spoke English)and thanked us. I hope our review ensures continued excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ath17
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent. Within walking distance of the major attractions, but in a quiet spot away from the big city congestion. Rooms were elegant and tasteful. Staff was very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, friendly, excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: TexasYokel
Reviews.Content: Gave us two adjacent singles, larger than I expected. Interiors were very nice. Staff was very helpful with our requests for directions and recommendations. One evening I wanted to mail a package and pick up some train tickets and they plotted me a nice step by step map that made me feel comfortable going on the errand. Really great location right over the river from the old city and close to the Vatican. Very quiet, which we like. Nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: krasavitsa
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here this past Aug. The hotel is very nice, the room was very clean and not terribly small. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The location can not be beat. We walked everywhere. We did not take the bus at all. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: bethanie
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two nights stay and after reading the reviews on here I was very dissapointed. As others have said I agree the staff were aloof and almost rude (got ignored several times at reception and they would just start making calls). However in general I did not find any of the Italians over polite or helpful! I had booked a double deluxe for 160euro per night directly though them. When we arrived we were shown do a dull shabby room with dents in the walls and wall paper peeling off, the bed had a large dip in the middle and the cover looked filthy (not at all something you would expect from a 4*). I went back down to check this was the 'deluxe' I had booked.....it took a while but eventually we got shown to the deluxe we had booked. This room was far nicer and well worth the money. So one recommendation is to pay the extra for a deluxe!! Breakfast was just okay...rolls were stale and ham/cheese dried and curled up at the edges. The hotel did recommend good places to eat, one in particular being St.annes.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable for tourists”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Dei Melini from 13th to 17th of January 2006. We booked over a German Travel Agency for a very exceptable rate because of the low season (stay 4 -pay 3). The room (incl. bathroom)was very tastefull furnished, big enough for 4 overnights and in a good condition.The prices for the extras like minibar were ok. The breakfast was better than expected (danish pastries, different kinds of bread, fruits, cheese/sausages, jogurt etc.)The hotel is very good situated for shopping, eating and culture. Very disappointing was the service at the reception. The staff has been either ignorand or snobistic. So if you come from abroad (especially from the USA) you will find this habbits very strange... Just do it like the italians : take it easy or ignore. All in all it is was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Bernini and bottles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I usually check Tripadvisor before booking a room anywhere I stay and I've had pretty good success so far, so I figured I'd read some reviews and make a new choice. That choice turned out to be Dei Mellini, and I'm glad I made such an excellent decision! Perfect location, I love to walk so the journeys through the side streets and "across" town were all apart of the immersion into this beauty frenetic city. Frightening to most Americans, I found the taxi ride to our hotel not only magical but crazy-FUN! Take the metro too, its quick and convenient. If you are looking for a pleasant, enchanting stay, the Dei Mellini is your answer. Enjoy the city, enjoy the Dei Mellini!!

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: golfmom
Reviews.Content: the hotel was just ok. We travel alot mostly in the USA. There is no internet service in the rooms and in the lobby only dial up at 25 euros for 2 hours. The hotel is not that convient. The staff is just ok not very helpful with where your could dine etc.

Reviews.Title: “Dei Mellini perfect retreat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: fobs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dei Mellini from the 3rd-7th of January and had a wonderful time. We had a double deluxe room for 160 euro per night and the rooms were lovely. They were soundproof with blackout curtains soslept well each night. Lovely buffet breakfast included in the price. We found the staff extremely helpful from arriving when our bags wre taken care off to the map on arrival with all sights marked out to recommendations for eating out which were all good. This hotel was just across the river and very near to the Vatican and St. Peters. We walked everywhere to the colleseum and St. John of the lateran from the hotel. Bring good walking shoes and you are set. Loved the little patteserie just a short walk from thr hotel selling excelland pastries and coffees. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a short break in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You get your money's worth!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a vacation in Rome. We spent six nights at the Dei Mellini and despite several major problems with their service, we loved the hotel and would stay there again. We paid 260. euros a night for a beautiful non-smoking suite on the fourth floor. It was quiet, clean and well-appointed. It had a small bedroom, separate living room, grand foyer and large marble bathroom. Value for our money was far exceeded! Breakfast and taxes were included in the rate. I searched high and low and the Dei Mellini had the best rooms at the best rates in Rome! I would have loved to have had tea-making facilities in the room, but other than that, it was a great room. That being said, we had major problems with their service. If you need help with tours, supper reservations, airport transfers, etc., then you may want to consider another hotel. For example, we arrived in Rome on Christmas Day. We knew taxis at the airport would be scarce or very expensive, so we arranged for an airport transfer with the hotel via email. We reconfirmed by telephone the day before we left. No car and driver waiting on us when we arrived! We called the hotel and they denied having received the email OR the telephone call. We took the train into the city center and caught a taxi at the train station. Could have been worse, but I was fuming by the time I got to the hotel! No apologies, shrugged it off when I showed them a copy of THEIR email to me confirming the transfer. Our taxi driver had to help us with our luggage because the bell person was standing at the desk chatting and laughing on the telephone and couldn't be bothered. We dealt with three different desk clerks during our stay and their attitudes ranged from indifferent to aloof. Service in the breakfast room ranged from completely ignoring us to bringing us ice cold "hot" tea as we were getting ready to leave. We didn't visit the little bar area, but the barmen went out of their way to say good evening each night. The room service menu had a wide selection, was well-priced and quite good. Breakfast was excellent with cold meats and cheese, fresh fruit, cold cereal and lots of breads and pastries. Despite the total lack of service and no on-site restaurant, we were elated with the room, the location and the price! If you are an independent traveller and can get around on your own, then the Dei Mellini is your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Great base to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mellini from Dec 30th until Jan02 after reading the reviews on this site. The location is great yet the hotel is still in a quiet safe area where you can retire from the hustle and bustle of Rome, when your feet are aching from the walking. The room was on the second floor and was well presented and looked after each day by the housekeeping staff. We had arranged pick up at Ciampino airport with Christiano at ----, again after reading about the company on this website. It cost €35 euro as opposed to €60 euro other people we met had been quoted from other sources.In addition our driver took the scenic route along the old Via Appia through Rome so we were able to see lots of the main sites on the way to our hotel. The Mellini is an ideal hotel to use as a base to see the main sites. The Vatican is very close by and on the same street is a great little restaurant called Vito's which serves simple, good, cheap food.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This one is tough to pass up, especially if you are on a budget. We stayed during the busy August holiday season (not so busy in Rome). It is a great quiet location near the Vatican and Castel Sant'Angelo. Rome is a great town to walk and everything is accessible. Thus, it was perfect to stay on the "quiet" side of the Tiber. 140 euros a night weekday special was fantastic. The hotel is very modern, clean and updated. The rooms, while a little small, were plush and gave us a sense of luxury - with complimentary bathrobe and slippers. The complimentary breakfast was above average but not great, but well laid out. There is a small, separated courtyard that is nice for privacy, as well as a quiet rooftop terrace. The only negative, if it is one, is that the Hotel does not have any amenities i.e. a pool, restaurant etc. But there are enough things in Rome to distract the visitor. The bartender recommends a place down the block for dinner. I did not enjoy this place. It is basically a bar with below average food and service. Cross over the Tiber and delve into the plethora of restaurants around Piazza Navona - a ten minute walk. Great deal in my opinion. The desk is a little cold but ultimately helped with getting cabs, answering questions etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DouglasB
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice room although the bath was tiny, very average breakfast, the restaurant recommended by the hotel on the same street was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: aria
Reviews.Content: I came in at 8:00am from an 18-hour flight and was very tired, the front desk woman wasn't so hospitable and warm. the bellboys never smile and have scowls on their faces. we were supposed to be on the 4th floor but they changed it to the ground floor. the room was small and has no view. breakfast was unmemorable. for dinner, we asked them to recommend a restaurant, they sent us to a place where we were surrounded by fellow tourists. there is no internet connection in the room, you can only access it thru thr public PC in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent suggested this hotel. It couldn't have been more perfect of a location. It is walking distance to Vatican City and also the Spanish steps (it is pretty much right in the middle of the two). The concierge couldn't have been more helpful. Clean rooms and the continental breakfast was perfect. It was much better than the continental breakfasts here in the States. I would compare the hotel to a nice Marriott. I would say the hotel is comparable to a $300-$350 room in the States. Would def stay here again. Kristin from LA

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just a walk away from everything -”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dei Mellini 2 weeks ago and it was great. The staff were very nice and the complimentary breakfast in the morning was great. Don't get it delivered to your room though if you don't want to pay. It's free downstairs. My advice would be to go to a little grocery store on the side streets and buy some bottled water and whatever kind of soda you like then take that with you in a backpack wherever you go since it costs an arm and a leg to eat and drink. There is a store just to the left of the post office which is about 20 yards to the right if your exiting the hotel. The rooms were spacious, they had internet service downstairs, but most iomportantly, you can walk almost anywhere. I would take a taxi to the Colesseum and Forum, but beyond that, the majority of the major sites are within walking distance (if your in decent shape).

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As others have said, I couldn't believe that a hotel could have such wonderful reviews... that is, until we arrived! The service was exemplary, the rooms gorgeous. Even though this isn't the most expensive hotel available in Rome, we were treated as though we were royalty. Breakfast was a treat! Thanks to TripAdvisor for helping us find this place.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 night stay at Dei Mellini. Rooms were very nice. Service was good, and although the breakfast room was quite small it was run very efficiently. The only thing that I was suprised with was some of the people on reception could be a bit abrupt. I thought the location of the hotel was good. It is close to everything but not in the middle of th busiest parts which suited us fine. I would definately recommend this hotel to people. The one negative thing that I would say about Rome is DO NOT GO ON THE CRUISE OF THE RIVER TIBER. It is filthy and you cannot actually see anything except graffiti and people sleeping under bridges.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price, worth to return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights at the end of August 2005. The service and rooms were excellent. Very clean, very discreet, very upscale. The breakfasts were like poetry. People are very nice, friendly and always very helpful. Good for families (we stayed with 18 months old baby). Close to everywhere (Piazza Navona, Piazza Di Poppolo, Vatican, Spanish Steps, Via Del Corso). We cannot imagine better stay in lovely and charming city of Rome. Grazie ! Marek & Agata, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place. Good value. Location just okay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot say anything bad about the Hotel Mellini as far as it's facility goes. The rooms were clean, bathrooms spotless, very nice breakfast buffet, and great employees. It's about a one mile walk from the Vatican but if I had to go to Rome again I think I'd stay somewhere on the other side of the Tiber River. The Mellini is still walking distance from everything but I like hotels that put you really in the middle of everything. Rome is a walking city and I think you're better off staying somewhere closer to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Campo De Fiore, Trevi Fountain, etc. That said, if you want to save a couple of bucks and don't mind walking the extra 1/2 mile I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: daisyage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dei Mellini Hotel at the end of August based on the Trip Advisor reviews. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, it is spotlessly clean, our room was brilliant. The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle but also within walking distance of all the sights. Remember your walking shoes! I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is good”
Reviews.Author: GeoffSturdy
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini hotel lived up to expectations - given all the positive reviews this was quite a tall order; but the hotel was superb. Our stay compared favourably with our last hotel which was the metropole in brussels (5 star) - the staff were excellent. Book this hotel - you will not be disapointed

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serena107
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff was extremeley friendly and helpful. Alejandro the front desk employee helped us out on many occasions and was the perfect employee. The room was clean and well designed and stocked with a handy mini bar. The location couldn't be better. It was very close to many of the main attractions, St Peters, Spanish steps and Piazza Navona. It was also close to many resteraunts and shops. I loved the hotel and Rome. Although be prepared to do alot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dei Mellini hotel for 3 nights from 20th August. The hotel was lovely, very clean and well maintained. The room was large and comfortable. The reception rooms were really nice, clean and light & the large roof terrace was lovely. All the hotel staff were very friendly & helpful and all spoke very good English. The hotel itself is within walking distance of all the main sites. The Vatican is a 10 minute walk along the river. The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Pantheon are about a 15 minute walk. Rome is a beautiful city to which I will definately return and I would not hestitate stay at the Dei Mellini again.

Reviews.Title: “this place is great”
Reviews.Author: bc10
Reviews.Content: we choose this place based on the reviews from trip advisior and it turned out great. this place was perfect, its close by to all the great resturants and sights in rome. and it was so nice to come back to a place to rest after a hard day of sightseeing, HOTEL DEI MELLINI was the perfect place. you wont regret the stay

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: ANN189400
Reviews.Content: Last October I travelled with my husband in Rome and stayed at the hotel Dei Mellini in Via Clemente, very close to the city centre, shops, restaurants and museaums. We had a lovely time, not only because the weather was beautiful and we could walk all day admiring this lovely city and enjoy the beauty of Rome. Our stay in Dei Mellini was a wonderful experience, starting from the check-in where we were welcomed by Massimo!! He was excellent, very friendly and happy to provide with all kinds of information and help us with restaurant reservations, tours and shopping tips. The room was very spacious, quite modern and bright, always perfectly made and comfortable. Breakfast was just right, and the service excellent. The tours we took were amazing, a very nice experience was walking in Villa Borgeuse Park..Also, dont forget to drink a hot chocolate and eat a delicious tiramisu at Cafe Grec at Via Condotti! Whenever I ever travel back to Rome, I will definately go to Dei Mellini!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here Without Fear”
