Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you’ve never been to Rome and you don’t know where to stay – or if you’ve been there and stayed at an awful place, this is a safe bet and well worth the price. It’s clean, comfortable, friendly…all the stuff the other reviewers say. The immediate neighborhood is very quiet (good or bad, depending on your tastes) but all the good stuff is no more than a 15-20 minute walk away. Wandering through Rome is, of course, why you go there. But a lot of walking means a lot of exercise – and this hotel is certainly not in the heart of things. It IS very close. Nevertheless, within 2 blocks you’ll find a farmacia (drug store/apothecary), an ATM, good coffee and pastries, great authentic roman cuisine, the bus and train, and a small bit of shopping (cool stuff, too). You’ll also find Vito’s, a café/pub/grill just down the street that stays open late and is quite a bit of fun – the food is very good but a bit overpriced compared to what you can get from a 5 minute walk elsewhere. Good for drinks and meeting people from all over the world. As far as safety goes, there’s a Cabrinieri station (a kind of military/police) 2 or 3 doors down…so there is always a strong police presence in the neighborhood. In fact, we found a strong police presence nearly everywhere we went. Granted, we were there just a month after the London subway attack so this might have been a high-alert measure. Funny though – all our friends warned us about gypsies, hustlers and a seedy element that pervades the city. “Among the most dangerous cities in the world” I read somewhere, but that was NOT our experience at all. Again, could be due to the heavy security so be sure not to let your guard down. You’ll need a cab for the airports and Termini (the train station) but the staff is happy to help and very ‘hop to’ when things need to be tended to. Don’t bother telling a cab driver to step on it. That’s the only way they drive! I would call the accommodations ‘American-style’. I've found the European idea of comfort and convenience is a bit different than the American. Not good or bad mind you – just different. For example, there’s a chance you’ll run out of toilet paper in your room while you’re there (Note there’s a clean restroom in the lobby). Or you might notice you had 2 water glasses yesterday but today there is only one. All small problems and this hotel is REALLY GOOD at making sure you’re very happy and well taken care of. And the complimentary breakfast was much better than expected!

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!!”
Reviews.Author: RPKVancouver
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotel we stayed at in Europe! All staff are friendly and eager to help. Rooms are very nice. Located in the quiet part of town but within walking distance to all of the sites. We have nothing bad to say about The Hotel Dei Mellini. We would recommend this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Only four stars? Should be five !!!”
Reviews.Author: trevorcaroline
Reviews.Content: Believe all the good reports on this hotel. I booked it on the strength of the many who wrote on trip advisor, so my expectations had been raised very high. Descriptions of friendliness, location, tranquillity, good breakfasts, and “a little gem” were all true. We received a friendly and warm welcome to Rome by the gentleman on reception. Even though we arrived about 1130am, he made no issue about being too early to check in. The bellboys were summoned, and 2 staff appeared to assist us with our luggage. They spoke excellent English probably due to their contact with the many American guests who use this hotel. The deluxe double room we were allocated was very spacious, with high ceilings, furnished in a classical style. The bed was one of the biggest kings I have ever seen and very very comfy. A second temporary bed for our child was easily accommodated. It had a digital safe, mini bar, and TV that appeared to only offer 9 local Italian channels. The aircon was effective and near silent. The bathroom was small, finished in Italian marble with lots of toiletries, luxurious towels, hairdryer and bathroom scales. The breakfast room was bright and clean, the selection was excellent, most would be very satisfied with whats on offer. A cooked breakfast could be ordered at extra cost. There were also several internet PC’s in the lobby. There is also the rooftop sun terrace with padded sun loungers and a stock of towels. There isn’t really a view from the rooftop, but it is a pleasant retreat for those seeking to relax outside. There were one or two reports that criticised location, so here’s my opinion. Yes it is in a quiet residential side street, and there are few restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Whilst some describe it as ‘perfectly located’ between the Vatican and the historical centre etc, that depends on how much walking you are prepared for. You are in between the two --- and not that close to either, as they are both a 15 minute walk away. However, this hotel has rather unique qualities not easily found elsewhere, and despite the location, there is an easy solution for those who don’t like to walk. Reception can order a taxi. Five euros will take you to the main tourist traps - Piazza Navona or the Spanish Steps, ten euros take you to the Termini or the Colloseum. Otherwise it is a very pleasant stroll along and over the river with no hills to negotiate. There is also the Rome Metro (nearest station 10mins walk north west of the hotel) where you can cross the city avoiding heavy traffic. A day pass for the metro is only four euros. The Dei Mellini may only have a four star rating, but in my estimation it could get five stars with its attention to detail. I would most certainly stay there again, and so should you!

Reviews.Title: “Top ice cream round the corner!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel after seeing reviews on TripAdvisor. You can't possibly go wrong with this hotel. Ideally located. 15 minute walk across the bridge and into the centre storico and you were standing by the Spanish Steps! Service very friendly. Rooms modern and clean. Contemporary style hotel with a great roof garden for a couple of beers from the mini-bar after a days trecking. And just round the corner (opposite the bridge Ponte Cavour) is a fabulous gelateria frequented by few toursists and lot's of locals. Great place to watch the world go by and tuck into some top ice cream! I would definitely recomend this hotel for a short break in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the very pleasant Mellini for 3 nights. Had arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport, but were not prepared for the speed and lack of driving rules that are now obvious in Rome! Had we had children with us, we would not have been amused at all. On arrival at the hotel, the staff could not have been more helpful. Very welcoming, and made us feel instantly comfortable in their surroundings. Our junior suite was very comfortable - plenty of room, storage space and very clean. The hotel was within walking distance to all the main tourist areas, yet in a very quiet street away from all the noise and traffic. You have to come prepared to walk in Rome - alot. We found the Mellini good value for money, very clean, and the staff were very helpful. Would not need to think twice about staying here again or recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: dmytreboe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in July and loved it! The location was perfect. It is on a nice quiet street just off the Tibur, but it was in walking distance to everything. We walked everywhere!! Never took a taxi. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very helpful. They recommended a great local restaurant for dinner one night that was amazing. The breakfast was also very good. We would definately stay here again if we we returned. By the way, we got a great price of just over $500 dollars for 3 nights, which included taxes and services from expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: MMusing
Reviews.Content: Don't be deceived by the hype that this place has been found by Hollywood. The only Los Angelenos who would stay here are budget-minded accountants. And while the lobby areas are stylish enough, the rooms look like they were decorated by an Italian grandma and, with the frayed rugs and stained chair cushions, rather in need of a renovation. But don't get me wrong, either. Our room was spacious by Rome hotel standards and everything worked, including the maid service. The location, on a side street in a character-less residential neighborhood, is delightfully quiet and well placed, i.e. a 20-minute walk to the Vatican to the west and the Spanish Steps to the east. So while dining spots are limited in the neighborhood, you're able to walk to plenty of good choices. The front-desk staff is typically Italian, ranging from cordial and occasionally helpful to brusque. Overall, a decent place to stay, and compared to the competition, pretty affordable. But at these prices, a little more glamour, friendliness and general shine wouldn't hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Kaimanas_Mom
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini was perfect for our week stay in Rome. The location was to die for - a 15 minute walk down the river to Vatican City or a 15 minute walk across the bridge to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, wonderful shopping, etc. I stress the walking part though. Everywhere you want to go is a walk from the Dei Mellini, but for how quiet the location was, it was well worth it. The hotel is not big by any means. It is a small, quaint hotel in a residential area. There are some restaurants within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. A 10 minute walk would net you 10 more restaurants to choose from. The rooms are nicely appointed. Not large, but very comfortable. All was very clean. The only complaint we had is that housekeepping did not always check our supply of toilet paper. One morning, my husband walked around our floor to find a cart, only to find out they did not carry toilet paper on their carts! Kind of odd! The staff here is pretty helpful. We noticed a few of them worked both the breakfast buffet and the bar until closing time. One night, my husband and I were in the hotel bar having a drink and an American woman was upset with the bartendar because he wouldn't take her "American money." My husband quietly and graciously offered to exchange her money for her into Euros so she could pay her bar tab, but the damage had already been done. We were embarrassed by this woman. She's in a foreign country who doesn't share the same currency as her home country. It's no wonder Americans have such a bad reputation when travelling abroad! Other than that, Dei Mellini is truely a diamond in the Eternal City. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SailingTheSevenSeas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mellini for three nights in July. Really good breakfast, great staff and very clean room. Spacious bathroom and good sized bed. As a nice evening touch they put slippers by the bed and pull down the sheets. Walking distance to Piazza del Popolo and Spanish steps and a convenient short bus ride to the Colosseum and other sites. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmf4003
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel situated close to ALL Rome's attractions. Helpful staff. Large room, beautiful bathroom. Roofdeck. Great breakfast. If you can get a deal on this hotel - don't bother looking anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A welcome refuge in the city!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I have used Trip Advisor to book a hotel - but now I have become a regular! The location of this hotel in Rome is perfect - a short walk to the Vatican and the spanish steps (hotel is almost in the middle of the 2 sights). The only time we took a cab was to go to the coloseum - the hotel is just central to everything! VERY nice staff - we had our 10 month old baby and they had a great crib for him and were always so nice. Breakfasts are good - obviously different than what American's expect - but I guess that's why we went to europe! Beds were a tad on the harder side for my personal taste but nice. Very clean rooms and on a quite steet. We were here in May 2005 and the building across the street was completely in bloom with purple wisteria trees! Beautiful! Have the hotel book you a car to drive you back to the airport - this really helped us out. They all speak english. A wonderful place! We would stay here again and have referred it to our friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: susiemd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in March, 2005 and were very pleased. I would definitely stay here again. The staff was very helpful, the hotel had all of the amenities and the neighborhood was convenient and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel near the Tiber River”
Reviews.Author: RCO
Reviews.Content: I took my teenage niece on her first trip to Rome in May. We stayed at the Mellini for 1 week..The rooms were lovely - heavy starched linen, nice bathrooms with tub, luxurious drapes and furnishings. The service was top notch and the breakfast buffet more than adequate to address everyone's, including Americans, taste. The breakfast room was large enough so that you don't have to wait for a table. Security was important as we were frequently out late in the evenings to enjoy shopping and dinner; the Mellini is in a very quiet neighborhood within walking distance of all the sights. We especially enjoy the non-smoking breakfast room and hotel lobby! Since the hotel is small (80 rooms total), we did not have to deal with invasion of tour groups and noisy buses. We enjoyed shopping in shops in the area - esp in COIN, a Roman department store. The area around Piazza Poppolo has many nice small restaurants that serve excellent food at very reasonable prices. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After searching for weeks for a great, yet reasonable hotel in Rome, we settled on the Dei Mellini. The price on their site, and other travel sites was nearly twice as much as the rate we got on Expedia. I have stayed in many Italian hotels, and this was 10 times better than we had hoped for. The room was spacious, the bathroom was immaculate and decorated in marble, and the Etro toiletries were such a treat. I would highly recommend this hotel - great price, great location (walking distance to most sites), and a nice breakfast is included in the price. The only thing I can complain about is the service at the front desk. When traveling abroad, we often ask for front desk staff for local restaurants that are hidden gems. The staff at the Dei Mellini kept recommending places that were obviously giving kickbacks to the hotel, b/c when we went to one of the places, all the patrons were non-Italian! Other than that, this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 7 night stay at the Hotel Dei Mellini. We are very well traveled and have high standards when it comes to hotels. This Hotel far exceeded our standards. Although not in the middle of Rome (although nice being a bit away from the tourist traps and loud streets) the Hotel is in easy walking distance from the Vatican, Spanish Steps and Piazza Navona/Pantheon. Our room was large and comfortable. We had a double superior room that was very large with a king-sized bed and nice bathroom (room 312 if you want to request it). The staff was always willing to help and recommended a number of good restaurants (ask Fabio) and a great private tour guide for the day. Very easy to get a taxi (ask front desk) and only a 25 minute drive from the airport. When we return to Rome we will surely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a two night break at Hotel Dei Mellini. A lovely, stylish hotel within easy walking distance of the Vatican and the rest of the sights. Check out the roof terrace for relaxing in the sun. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: frootloops
Reviews.Content: just a quick review :- A really nice hotel. Everything is kept clean and tidy, the staff are friendly and helpfull, the beds are comfortable and the street is nice and quiet. best of all they have mozzarella balls as part of the breakfast buffet :-) It is not right in the center which means it wont suit people that cant be bothered with walking.

Reviews.Title: “delightful Dei Mellini”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night break at the hotel Dei Mellini to celebrate my husband's "significant" birthday. We were very impressed by our room and all the lovely toiletries, robes, slippers etc. that were provided. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful, and there were nice touches like being brought complementary olives and pistachio nuts when you ordered drinks in the bar. The enclosed courtyard was a very relaxing place to enjoy a glass or two of wine after an evening out. There are some nice restaurants quite close by, and our favourite was called Clok. The food there was excellent. All the main attractions are within walking distance, although we did get a taxi to the Colloseum one morning so that we arrived feeling fresh as the weather was very hot. We had a great time and we would definitely like to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: wikki
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dei mellini for 5 nights in March and really enjoyed. The hotel was of a very high standard, rooms very clean and well kept, nice bar area and breakfast room. The staff were very helpful. The only drawbacks were the lack of restaurant in the hotel and the location. LOCATION The hotel is situated down a quiet side street but is about a 30 - 40 minute walk to the main attractions of St Peters and in the opposite direction the same distance to the Colleseum. It is a nice area and you can be assured of a good nights sleep however there are only a handful of moderate restaurants in the immediate vicinity - the best being Clock restaurant , just 5 minutes down the end of the road. The majority of the main attractions are situated over the other side of the bridge. RESTAURANT We will a little disappointed at the hotel's lack of restaurant and had there been one available, this would have undoubtedly have pushed our rating to 5*. The hotel does cater for breakfast and provides an adequate buffet style breakfast. Due to the location , we found that we would have to venture out in the evening to look for somewhere to eat. This was not always ideal as we spent all out days sightseeing and therefore would have enjoyed relaxing in the hotel in the evening. One of the nicest restaurants that we found was near Piazza Venetiza (over the bridge) and it was called the Jazz Cafe. This was a chic restaurant catering in pizza, pasta etc and a large selection of cocktails. We would also recommend Pizza 8 which was a family run, traditional Italian restaurant. This was very near the hotel and on the way to St Peters. All in all, a very enjoyable stay but if we did ever return to Rome, we would stay closer to the main attractions as that would help to get a sense of traditional Italy. The hotel was lovely but situated in the very quiet business district and a bit 'out of the way' from everything. SIGHTSEEING We would recommend a visit to the beautiful St Peter's Bascillica. We were lucky as when we arrived there was a free tour taking place of the history of the building/art work. This was excellent and lasted approx 1 hour. Keep a look out for the American guide near the main entrance as they wer handing leaflets out when we arrived. We also would recommend the Colleseum guide and also the Vatican Museums - though don't go early in the morning as it is a complete nightmare!!!! No room to move with the hoards of people!!!!!! The best time to go is around midday - though the museums close early at around 3 ish. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - One of the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: BWS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May 2005. The hotel is located in a quiet street well away from the busy Rome streets. This is honestly one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The service was excellent. We stayed on the 2nd floor in a large room that was in fact 2 - the first consisting of a room with its own toilet/TV/table and a king size sofa bed. The main bedroom had its own bathroom/TV/chest of drawers/wardrobe/desk/chair and king size bed. The room was totally quiet and a nice respite after a long day. The breakfast was an adequate continental type breakfast. The hotel is close enough to walk to nearly every site seeing area in Rome. There is also located in the street a small and cheap supermarket which was handy. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes located in the vicinity. Most highly recommending!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Pot&Pan
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a long-weekend in Rome. We booked the hotel Dei Mellini after reading the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. There are more centrally located hotels, but Dei Mellini offers the best of both worlds -a quiet street 5 mins from the river, yet within walking distance of the action !. It is small, intimate with superb attention to detail. The bedroom was well equipped and comfortable - you need a comfortable bed after all the walking & sight seeing !. Breakfast is adequate with ceral, toast etc [no English breakfast, thank goodness !]. A hotel well worthy of its 4* rating. You MUST hop on the Bus/ route 110 which takes in all the sights - a bargain at 13 Euro's. You can hop on & off as many times as you like !. Enjoy Rome, it is a wonderful city....we certainly thought so !.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madden
Reviews.Content: The Dei Mellini was wonderful ... super location, a nice room with a good bed, the staff were outstanding. All the major sites are within walking distance! The next time we return to Rome we'll book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: ladyfelsham
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just come back from a four night stay at the Dei Mellini, and we loved it! It's located down a quiet street (a major bonus in car horn mad Rome) 10-15 mins walk from the Vatican City and 2 minutes to the Tiber, a bit further to the Pantheon, the Trevi fountain, the Colosseum and the Forum - but everything in Rome is worth the trek. We ended up doing at least 5 miles a day, but managed to make it up to ourselves with all the fabulous food and icecream on offer! The hotel staff were always courteous, smiling and helpful, and all speak some English. There's a nice, albeit small, bar area in the foyer, with another small terrace area opposite. There's also a roof terrace, with disappointing views of the satellite dishes on the roof across the road - but nonetheless still a nice spot to have a drink in. The room was large, clean, with a fab kingsized bed, free slippers, a bathrobe to use during your stay, free toiletries and lovely big white towels. Most importantly, it had very efficient A/C. Would also recommend a cafe - head to the river and turn right, it's by the next bridge up. Lovely food and very cheap - in fact, Rome's restaurants are very good value in general, and we didn't once have a dud meal.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. The location is great - within walking distance to most sites, yet is in a nice quiet neighborhood. Rooms were very clean, breakfast was more than adequate and the staff helpful. But the highlight was the bartender, Fabio. He was so helpful. He recommended a restaurant one night which was very good and the other night (when we just wanted a quick bite) he whipped us up some antipasto and pasta - what a fun time we had with him. Fabio definitely made our stay extra special!

Reviews.Title: “Thorougly recommended, has risen from 15th to 9th on TripAdvisor within weeks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the middle of April 2005. Having researched Rome hotels on Tripadvisor we picked this one due to its location and price (and positive reviews here - 15th in Rome when we booked). We were not dissapointed, the hotel was very clean and modern and the staff friendly - when we realised we'd forgotten our UK travel plug adaptor they pointed out two local retailers where we were able to buy one! We asked for some cake with a coffee at the bar and although they didn't seem to do this as standard, they provided it from the selection they obviously had waiting for breakfast the next day and didn't charge us for it! As previously said here, very near to several major attractions/sites particularly the vatican. The standard breakfast is continental but this was very good indeed as was the coffee. We would thorougly recommend this hotel and certainly consider staying again. It was certainly one of the best hotels we've stayed in in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel really is as good as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: Jansolo
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, including Tripadvisor reviews, I chose this hotel for a 3 night weekend break 15th - 18th April. We've just got back and it was all I'd hoped for. The room was comfortable and clean and most important of all, very quiet. The staff are all helpful and friendly and most speak English fairly fluently. The hotel isn't far from any of the major sites and is close to the Tiber and near the Palace of Justice and Piazza Cavour. The furthest main site is probably the Colisseum/Palatine and even that took barely half an hour to reach on foot. It's convenient for the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Villa Borghese etc. etc. Considering how heavy the traffic is, it's probably easier to walk around Rome anyway than bother with a taxi, so this hotel was perfect for us. There are plenty of places to eat close by, from a bar just over the road which was basic but excellent, to the tourist traps around the Piazza Navona. It's worth taking a good guide (I used the Rough Guide to Rome) and looking for restaurants a little away from the main tourist routes as not only are the prices better, often the food is too. All in all I'd recommend this to anyone who wants a quiet hotel in a convenient location and with good amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The stay here made our trip memorable!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here over the Bank Holiday Easter weekend. I booked this having read all other reviews, and the stay here made our trip. It is a clean hotel and has friendly staff. Walking from the hotel to the vatican city only takes 10 mins across the riverside. It is worth the money we paid, they even leave slippers at night, and turn over the bed sheets for you!! They even left us easter eggs too, they pay attention to detail, and the staff and facilities are more than adequate. Having spent all day travelling around the city on foot, makes it worth coming back to "home"!! Although it does not serve dinner in the evening, the service and stay was great, I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Hokie9
Reviews.Content: This is a bvery nice little hotel. Lovely rooms and bathrooms. The servic is good and the breakfast is nice. I will say that the location is a bit of a walk to the sites. I like coming home to a little peace adn quiet, but you need to take cabs everywhere if you are not a walker.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at this hotel, you know it's in a class of its own. The doorman, bellboy, and reception people were great. The only problem I encountered coming from the US was the AC, although it was in the 60's outside, inside it fell a little stuffy, and Europeans are not too keen on AC. There were slippers, spa like robes and a great minibar. The bathroom was all marble and big for european standards. The location was great, didn't have to worry about the noisy streets that include thousands of motocycles and cars. The staff provided us with great suggestions of where to eat nearby, and it was great. Only 2 city blocks from many buses. We found that we could walk almost everywhere if you like to walk, and if you like shopping (like me) this location was heaven, located only 5 blocks from the famous Via Del Corso, where most italians do their fashion shopping. Definitely a place I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1
Reviews.Content: I booked this based on what I read here- all true! The location is really a 10 minute walk to both the Vatican area and the Spanish steps. The neighborhood is quiet and very safe. We were here for Easter so it was nice to get away from the crowds and enjoy the quiet. The room was ready early and we had a nice twin room overlooking the street. The room was clean, nice and big for Italy. The bathroom was gorgeous as were the linens and the bath products- they even did nightly turndown. The breakfast was plentiful and the staff was very helpful in all areas. I would highly recommend this for a great stay in Rome at a great price. I booked it on Expedia for approx. $225/night which included the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Rome for a short break. The Hotel dei Mellini was fantastic! Only a short walk from the major sites (Piazza Navona, Pantheon etc) Breakfast was filling and enjoyable and the room was of a very high standard- slippers provided! I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel dei Mellini is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: PrincessVCD
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Italy and have to say that the Hotel dei Mellili in Rome is outstanding. The staff was amazing - very attentive and helpful. The rooms were clean, large (in European standards) and offered great bathrooms. We had a room for 3 and it contained 2 full beds, large closets, safe 1 1/2 baths and a sitting area that fit a large loveseat (3rd bed), table that seated 4, 2 TVs. The location (on the left of the Tiber) was ideal. We could walk to all sights within 10-30 minutes. And did I mention the staff - WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Havlat
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting trip to Rome, it was a great pleasure to arrive at the Mellini for our two night stay. The hotel staff were very friendly when we arrived. The hotel was very clean and seemed newly renovated. The room we had was small but very clean. The bathroom was very nice and came equipped with Etro supplies. Don't stay at this hotel if you are looking for a view or lots happening around it. Although it is very close to the vatican, popolo and surprisingly close to sites as Navona and the Pantheon. We did find it hard to find a good place to eat near the hotel. It is in a quiet area and on a sunday and monday a lot of things seemed to be closed at night. The breakfast was very enjoyable, fresh fruit, lovely pastries and a great staff to make sure your day started just right. A very relaxing and clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Rome perfect”
Reviews.Author: K_Crockett
Reviews.Content: We rented two rooms for my family of four, and I couldn't have been happier with the Dei Mellini. Both rooms were beautiful, spacious by Rome standards, well-appointed and well-maintained. The beds were extremely comfortable. Everything worked perfectly - hot water, lights, A/C. I heard many stories about Rome hotels being shabby - not this one. The Dei Mellini is in great condition. The hotel staff were extremely professional and helpful. They gave us two rooms directly across the hall from each other, which was perfect. The breakfasts were delicious. I enjoyed the rooftop terrace, where we would share a bottle of wine, or I would lay out on a lounge chair in a private section with an outdoor shower. The location is ideal. The area is residential and quiet. There are no traffic noise issues at this hotel. We loved being close to Piazza Navone. You are not giving up anything location-wise by being on the Vatican side of the river. We walked everywhere and had a wonderful time. When I return to Rome, I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: workplay
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay Feb 4-7th. They allowed early check in and upraded our rooms. All of the staff were friendly and accomidating except for the clerk working the front desk when we checked out on the 7th. All of the other front desk personel were great as were the rest of the staff. We found the location to be very central to the major sights and only felt the need to take a taxi once. The rooms were lovely and quiet. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, QUIET”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Dei Mellini. My brother and I (and our wives) spent New Year's in Rome, and could not have had a better stay at the hotel. It is quiet, the rooms are always spotless, and the service is truly wonderful. From Roberto on down, the staff is just great. If you have been to Rome, you know noise is a reality of life there. The hotel is in a quiet street, and if you really need quiet, ask for an interior room, facing a courtyard. They are one of the quietest rooms you will find anywhere. The hotel is located so close to everything, yet just far away from the crowds to make your stay marvellous. We'll be back to Rome, and to the dei mellini and that's saying a lot, as I am a very discerning traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Underdog
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Just returned from three nights at the Hotel Dei Mellini, chosen because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. We booked the Hotel direct on their winter rate of 150 inc breakfast for a deluxe double. We arrived an hour before our scheduled check-in yet this was not a problem, even better was that we we're upgraded to a Junior Suite at no extra cost. We had room 405 which had small vestibule containing a large built in wardrobe, mirror and the mini bar. There was also a small safe that was free of charge. We also had a lounge area with a sofa and easy chair, TV and a desk with chair. The bedroom had a large comfortable bed, a large set of draws, a chair and another TV. The bathroom was marble, with his and hers basins, a bath with shower over and two huge white fluffy bathrobes. Everything in the room was immaculate as in fact was every area within the Hotel. A couple of reviews had mentioned the breakfast being poor. Too us it was what you'd expect from a continental breakfast. Everything was fresh and there was plenty of choice. If you're idea of breakfast is 'full English' then you will be disappointed. There is a small bar and two lounge areas downstairs along with the breakfast room. They don't serve dinner (although there is a small room service menu) but we didn't find a problem as Rome obviously has plenty of good restaurants. There are at least four within a couple of minutes walk. We only tried one nearby (on the same street in fact) called CLOK, which was pretty good. The hotel staff are very friendly and they have some nice touches too. There is a turn down service each night where they leave you a pair of slippers and a small vanity sheet on each side of the bed. On our last night we were in our room from about 5pm until we went out for dinner at 9.15pm, yet when we came back they had again turned down the bed. The hotel is in a quite area of the city yet is only a 20 minute walk to the Vatican or the sites of Northern Rome. If you want a view out of your window don't come here, but if you want peace and quite away from the incessant traffic noise and car horns of the center of the city, you won't be disappointed. When we come back to Rome, which we will, we will be booking the Dei Mellini Just a point on the traffic. If it's your first time in Rome and you're thinking of hiring a car or even worse a scooter, to get about, DON'T. The way Romans drive is unbelievable. There is no lane discipline and cars and scooters just cut each other up all the time. No one uses the indicators or stops at zebra crossings. You need a strong nerve just to sit in the back of a taxi. If you're a London Motorcycle courier you may just about survive on a scooter, anyone else, you'll have no chance. One final tip. Before you go or even better while you're there, read Angels and Demons by Dan Brown. Not only is it a great book, but it's all set in Rome and you can visit the locations as you read about them.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: laura1
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed this lovely hotel. We stayed for 3 nights over New Year and I can't wait to go back! After many weeks of reading everything I could find about hotels in Rome I'd just about reached review overload, but decided on the dei Mellini. I have to say slightly with fingers crossed, as reviews are subjective aren't they. And something I consider important might not even feature on another person's agenda. However, I was most definetly not disappointed. The hotel was lovely, the staff very welcoming (including a good suggestion for a dinner venue on our first night - Cesari, which was excellent), a good spread for the breakfast buffet which goes on all morning, a 6ft wide bed (yes, to a Brit that's worth commenting on!) in our very comfortable, clean, tasteful, quiet (yes, no street noise!) room. We walked everywhere from the hotel, though they told us buses stopped close by if we wanted. But we were happy to walk and for our forays to take us down roads buses couldn't travel along. The Spanish Steps one way and the Vatican the other took about 15 minutes, and I don't walk fast. The Colosseum took a bit longer, but we did have a detour for lunch on route! We returned via the Bocca de Veritas in true Roman Holiday style.

Reviews.Title: “New Years 2005 in an EXCELLENT CITY AND EXCELLENT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband Joe and I just got back from our 6 day stay in Rome (Dec 28th-Jan 2nd). Hotel Dei Mellini is a fabulous hotel. The room was immaculate, with cleaning service twice daily, the staff was friendly and courteous, and the decor was lovely. The buffet breakfast (included with the room fee) was excellent, with a nice spread of breads, cakes, meats, cheeses, yogurts, cereal and your choice of coffee, tea, cappucino or hot cocoa! The hotel is located in a quieter residential nighborhood, on the western side of the River. Remember that most of the attractions are on the eastern side (except the Vatican) so you will have to make the short walk over the bridge towards Piazza Cavour daily. However, Public Transportation (bus and subway) is available from everywhere, so at night when you are tired from all the walking, the bus will drop you off right near the hotel! Although the majority of great restaurants are near the Spanish Steps, we really loved the ultra contemporary Cloc, located right near the hotel!! New Years in Rome was amazing and I think this is the best time of year to visit. There are many tourists, but not as busy as summer months and the weather is perfect for sight seeing. You definitely need a coat and maybe some gloves at nite! A short trip to ancient Ostia Antica is also a must. Overall, Rome is a wonderful city, with lots to see, everyone should plan to take a Roman Holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Hotel Mellini over New Year's. We can't say enough good things about the staff and the facilities of this hotel. From Anna at reception, to wonderful Fabio behind the bar, to the room amenities (bathrobes and slippers!) we were very pleased with the experience. Breakfast was great, as were the restaurant suggestions from the staff. This was our 8th or 9th trip to Rome and we wish we learned of this hotel earlier. Quiet neighborhood, yet convenient via one bridge to Pza del Popolo, another bridge to Pza di Spagna. We will use them from now on as our home away from home in our favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LenaG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel dei Mellini for 4 nights (Nov 24-28). Nice hotel, very well-trained and polite staff. Though, the restaurant is not open for dinner (breakfast only), but there are many good restaurants in a short walking distance (via Ripetta). Location is nice too – walking distance to St. Peter’s. Metro station is near by. Thanks to TripAdvisor, it was a nice choce.

Reviews.Title: “Really Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the first time I used Trip Advisor to help choose my hotel. The Dei Mellini was very comfortable, nice rooms, slippers, bathrobes, toiletries etc. The staff were extremely helpful to the extent of even organising tickets for the chaps to see Lazio play football in the Olympic Stadium. Breakfast was continental but you could pay extra for hot food. Restaurant recommendations and bookings were also freely given and didn't disappoint. Location 15mins from Vatican and 30mins from centre but neither walk a chore. Our taxi from the airport cost 87euro the return 50euro....we were had....next time I would get the hotel to organise the transfer both ways as they got us the fixed price return car which for 4 people I would say was fine. I will use Trip Advisor again!

Reviews.Title: “A very well located and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bootle45
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel not out of choice but because the hotel we originally booked was full and they transferred our booking to Mei Mellini. We were in a foul mood when we arrived, it was late at night and the children were fed up. We were not ready to accept an inferior hotel and we inspected the rooms before we checked in. We were very pleasantly surprised, we had a choice of rooms and the staff went out of their way to be helpful. The weather in November was fantastic and the roof garden was very pleasant. Very good breakfast plenty of choice. The location was excellent being within walking distance of The Vatican and Spanish Steps, we found several good inexpensive restaurants close by it was just a matter of walking down side streets and seeking them out. I would certainly recommend this hotel and Rome was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel and Ana made it wonderful.. Everything was perfect: room, location, breakfast, price, decor and staff especially Ana (who speaks perfect english). I would definately go back and would recommend anyone going to Rome to stay here. We went for our honeymoon in August 2004 and stayed 5 nights. I would have spent the entire two weeks there. If you are debating over a place to stay end your search here. As a side note have dinner at Il Pomodorino ask the staff they know where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ericajazmin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 4 days and loved this hotel. The staff was excellent and the location was fantastic. Are room had a beautiful marble bathroom and hall. The hallway in the room made it feel so much larger than it really was. We booked the hotel after it was recomended by AAA. It was very cozy and the breakfast was yummy. Good walking distance to a lot of tourist attractions. The only thing I would not recommend is going during August, a lot of locals go on vacation for the month and a lot of the shops are closed.

HotelInfo.Name: Dei Mellini Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Muzio Clementi, 81, 00193 Rome, Italy
